loans.name: Jane

texts.es:
Jane tiene 34 años de edad, trabaja como empleada en un grifo de su ciudad y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo saca adelante a su pequeño de 7 años de edad, a quien ama muchísimo.

Jane esta agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda los prestamistas kiva ya que Jane podrá comprar un pequeño terreno para poder construir su casa, así de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old. She is an employee at a petrol station in her city and with the income from her basic job she brings up her 7-year-old son, whom she loves very much. 

Jane is grateful for the support she gets from the Kiva lenders as she will be able to buy a small plot of land to build her house on. This means she will be able to keep striving towards making her big dream come true: to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three daughters. Her children go to the local school. 

Khatuna and her husband are unemployed now. The family lives in poverty, though it gets a pension from the government as being in poverty. Sometimes their relatives give them money for food. 

Khatuna has requested a loan several times, but her attempts were all rejected because of not having a stable income and her lack of experience. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, enables her to get a loan for starting a business. 

She will purchase dairy cows, will milk every day, and will produce dairy products to sell and to feed her children. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 61 years old and widowed, with two children.

Luciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks, like soap, milk, sugar, and spices.

Luciana has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years.

Luciana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like soap, milk, sugar, and spices.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une jeune femme mariée avec un docker et a un enfant âgé de 3ans. Elle est revendeuse et revend des parfums, des ustensiles de cuisine et du sucre à tous types de personnes. Par manque de liquidité, elle sollicite son premier prêt chez WAGES pour l’achat et la vente des parfums, des ustensiles de cuisines et du sucre. Elle espère à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique. Elle a débuté son activité en Janvier 2013.
texts.en:
Abla is a young woman who is married to a docker. They have a 3-year-old child. She is a retailer who sells perfumes, kitchen utensils and sugar to a mixed clientele. She started her business in January 2013.

Short on cash, Abla is seeking a first loan from WAGES to support her activity of buying and selling perfumes, kitchen utensils and sugar. 

In the long term, she would like to open a store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, kitchen utensils and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married, with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Helen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Maritza Oristila

texts.es:
La señora  Maritza  de 26  años de edad es casada,  tiene dos hijos  que dependen de ella  sus  hijos tienen  08 y 06 años, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y tiene casa propia.
Doña Martiza se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de tamales y pan y queso, su venta es ambulante y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que visita en sus casas.
Doña Maritza es una mujer trabajadora y desea sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de hojas de plátano, maíz, harina, leña y gallinas que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea obtener  ganancias que le permitan ir mejorando su casa,  es su sexto préstamo que solicita. Su sueño es mejorar su casa  y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Maritza is 26 years old and is married, with 2 dependent children aged 8 and 6. They live in the community of San Lorenzo in the South of Honduras and have their own house. For 5 years Maritza has been earning a living selling tamales and bread and cheese. She works as a street vendor, selling to friends and people who she visits in their homes. She is a hard working woman and wants to bring her family up well. 

Maritza is asking for the loan to buy banana leaves, corn, flour, firewood and chicken, which are the raw materials for preparing her tamales. With the help of this loan she wants to make profits which will enable her to make improvements to her home. This is the sixth loan she has requested. Her dream is to improve her home and business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves, corn, flour, firewood and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 41 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice and planting cassava. Chanthou has been a farmer for almost ten years and she earns about 24,000 KHR per day. She successfully used her first loan with VisionFund to improve her livelihood.

Chanthou is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farm. This will be her second loan. In the future, she hopes to increase her crop yield and sales so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia, age 40, is married and lives with his wife, retired mother and two school-age children in the Black Sea coastal town of Kobuleti. Gia is an internally displaced person and gets modest monthly social assistance from the government. His wife works as a baker at the local bakery, earning a modest salary.

Gia is a house painter and works on renovations, but his income is unstable, dependent as it is on customer orders. To increase his income, he has  requested this Start Up loan to purchase a parquet flooring machine so he can work on floor covering installations as well. According to his estimations, his earnings will double and he will be able to provide his family members with better living conditions. 

Gia hopes that Kiva lenders will be helpful to him.

loans.use: to purchase a parquet flooring machine

loans.name: Saet's Group

texts.en:
Saet, who is 56 years old, is a rural villager from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She is a widow and the mother of three children.

To strive for a living, she grows rice, cassava, and cashews as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Saet is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), and she has successfully repaid back the past loans already. 

The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to provide decent food for her family and promptly supported her business in a timely way. She leads a group consisting of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. 

She and her joint borrower are seeking a loan of KHR 1,100,000 each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farming and to pay plowing and transplantation fees. 

With this loan, she hopes to make a good income so she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farming

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en:
Man, 43, is married with six children, residing in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Three of the children are still in school. 

To support the family, Man has been selling fish and working for others for a fee. She and her husband having been in this business for almost 20 years. 

Man’s Group consists of two members who are both female and they both have been with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles. Man completely paid back the loans with VisionFund Cambodia and successfully used the loans to provide better support to her family. 

Man and her group member are applying for a new loan. Man will use her portion to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Som Art's Group

texts.en:
Som Art, a citizen from Dambae district, is 41 years old and a married mother of one son, who still counts on her. 

For 20 years, she has been growing cassava and cashews as a main source of income. 

This is Som Art’s fourth loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund Cambodia. The past loans have enabled her to improve her living conditions. 

For this cycle, Som Art is seeking a loan in the amount of KHR 1,400,000, while her co-borrower is applying for a loan of  KHR 1,200,000.

As the leader, Som Art will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her cassava and cashew plantation. She expects to double her crop yield, to sell at a good price, so as to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her plantation.

loans.name: Maira Yecenia

texts.es:
Doña Maira tiene una edad de 33 años es agricultora y ama de casa madre de 4 hijos los cuales viven con ella y su esposo y los apoyan con todas las diferentes actividades que diariamente realizan en los cultivos de café. Tiene un grado de educación secundario completo el cual pudo lograr gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo económico de sus padres con los cuales ella se siente muy agradecida. Ella en compañía de su esposo el cual es maestro de educación primaria se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya que diariamente ellos trabajan duro para sacar a sus hijos adelante, enseñarles el valor del trabajo e inculcarle buenos principios como el respeto y la honestidad ya que estos dos principios sobre salen en el ámbito del negocio para obtener buenas relaciones con sus clientes. Sus clientes son intermediarios, bodegas, pulperías, familiares y amigos que viven en la zona o llegan a la misma para para la adquisición de su producto.
Ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara abono (12 quintales de 18-46-0) y 9 quintales de urea para proteger y abonar sus cultivos de maíz, frijol y café ya que de esa forma ella podrá dar una mejor asistencia a sus cultivos. 
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café ya que la tierra que ellos tienen es propia y apta por su clima localidad y mantenimiento para el mismo. Su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que ellos tengan muchas opciones y oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, a farmer, housewife, and mother of four children who all live with her and her husband.  They support them with all their different daily activities related to raising coffee.  She has a junior high school education and she was able to achieve this thanks to the efforts and her parents’ financial support.  She is very grateful to them.  She and her husband, who is an elementary school teacher, raise and harvest coffee and they work hard every day to get their children ahead, teach them the value of work, and good values such as respect and honesty.  These are the principles that they use in their business to have good relationships with their customers.  Her customers are intermediaries, shops, stores, family, and friends who live in the area or go there to acquire their product.

She is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy fertilizer (12 quintals of 18-46-0) and nine quintals of urea to protect and fertilize her corn, bean, and coffee crops.  This way she can better help her crops.

Her plans for the future are to be able to raise a better variety of coffee, since they have their own farmland and good because of the local climate and soil.  Her dream is to be able to provide a good education for her children so that they will have many options and opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is studying business administration at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City.  Her mother, a widow with four chldren who attend school, is the only one earning an income for the family. She sells coconuts in town to make a living. The children help their mother on weekends in her business and with household chores. 

Catherine is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy school materials, books, etc. She hopes to finish her studies and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase school materials needed for the first semester

loans.name: Dathe

texts.fr: Dathe est un jeune homme célibataire âgé de 35ans. Il est un enseignant et pratique la vente et l’achat des matériels informatiques et d’ordinateurs.  Il exerce son activité dans une boutique. Il sollicite un premier prêt chez WAGES pour réinvestir dans son activité pour l’achat, la vente de matériels informatiques et d’ordinateurs. Il souhaite assurer  son activité et la voir grandir et assurer l’avenir de sa famille plus tard. Il a commencé à exercer depuis 2012.
texts.en:
Dathe is a single, 35-year-old teacher. He buys and sells computers and accessories out of a store. He started this activity in 2012. 

Dathe is seeking a first loan from WAGES to invest in his business. He would like to make his activity sustainable and see it expand so as to provide for a family in the future.

loans.use: to buy computers and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a hardworking and enterprising man who is still single. For the past three years, he has operated a kiosk where he sells items to his neighbors and passersby. Kelvin’s major business challenge is price fluctuation. He lives in his own house without electricity or running water. Kelvin decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Kelvin is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell. In the future, he dreams of opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary is married and a young mother of two children, both of whom are too young for school. She is a resident of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. For the past six years, Theary has been a cassava famer. This is the main source of her family’s income. Theary has successfully borrowed and repaid five previous loans with the Kiva partner VisionFund. She used her past loans to improve her family’s living conditions. 

Theary is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer for her crop and pay for plowing fees and labor costs for her farm. She hopes to increase her high cash-crop yields and get a good selling price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labors costs for her farm

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en:
Kathleen is a 19-year-old student at Stella Maris College who is studying business administration to earn a Bachelor of Science degree. Her mother is the only one earning an income for her family as her father has died. Kathleen’s family runs a business buying and selling coconuts to make a living. She has three siblings and providing for school fees and education is not easy. She and her siblings help their mother on the weekends in her business and by doing household chores.

Kathleen is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy school materials, books, and other items. In the future, she dreams of finishing her studies and becoming successful.

loans.use: to buy school materials, books, and other items

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 22-year-old single man. He has worked as a plumber for the past nine years to help supplement his parents' income and to cover the cost of his educational fees. He was only 13 years old when he started working, and now he has deep experience in his field.
 
In 2008, he started his own business providing his services to several customers in his region. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his university tuition fees. He will also use part of the loan to pay for his brothers' school fees, to make sure that they will keep on getting the necessary education they need for a brighter future.

He hopes to graduate soon and to start working in his field of study, and prove his abilities.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees and his brothers' education fees

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has four children and  he has been doing farming work for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

Gilbert stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "mixed farming." His biggest challenge is: "crop diseases." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Null."

Gilbert was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "low interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "They help us grow."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked: "how will this loan benefit his family?," Gilbert replied: "increase sources of income."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gilbert owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and bicycle,' but he does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, and running water,' but he does not have: 'electricity, sewing machine, TV or DVD.'

loans.use: to pay for construction of a green house.

loans.name: Kwa Ndevu Group

texts.en: Fatuma, who is in her mid 30s, is married and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. For the last 11 years, she has had a tailoring business and a shop where she sells clothes. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She lives in Tujijenge Tanzania, and this is her second loan request. She will use the loan to buy materials to make more clothes and buy more sarongs to resell. Fatuma used her previous loans to buy more tailoring materials, fabrics and sarongs and paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to help pay school fees and household expenses. She dreams of improving and upgrading her shop. Fatuma will share this loan with her group Kwa Ndevu, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more clothes and buy more sarongs to resell.

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en:
Latifan is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Latifan has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to do some engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services for his passengers. 

Latifan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Yawoavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée à un électricien frigoriste et a 5 enfants tous scolarisés dont le premier a 20ans et le dernier 8ans. Elle a commencé à exercer depuis 2003. Elle est revendeuse de sachets plastiques et de divers au grand marché. Elle demande un troisième prêt pour la vente de ses sachets plastiques, réinjecter les profits dans l’activité pour espérer l’ouverture d’une boutique. Elle désire assurer la bonne scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawoavi, age 40, is married to a refrigeration electrician. They have five children aged 8 to 20 years old who have all received schooling. 

Yawoavi sells plastic bags and various products at the market. She started this activity in 2003. 

She is seeking a third loan to help support her business. She plans to reinvest her profits in her activity and hopes to open a store at some point in the future. She also wants to ensure a proper education for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Iskender

texts.en:
Iskender is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International Comparative Politics and here is his story.

“The faculty of International Comparative Politics came to my mind when I was in 10th Grade. After I knew that history subject is one of the major subjects in this field, I entered an Olympiad studies in my lyceum. In 2002 Oblast History Competition I won fourth place. My teacher gave me a mass of information about this type of profession and gave an idea to study in AUCA, department of ICP, because she herself pursued her Masters’ Degree at this university. Many educated people I know are devoting themselves to society’s life and have education in this field. 

"The most I like in this profession is that it has many directions. A person who knows politics can manage the whole society. Politics is one of the most important parts of society’s life. So it is mostly about power. A politician is a person who knows  how the mechanisms of power look like and work. A politician can feel and use his or her power in the whole society’s life as well as in his little district. Politician’s work seems to me both important for society and for a person himself. To become a high qualified specialist in this field I chose to study at AUCA. 

"Another thing that attracts my attention in this field is that politicians bring together their work, journalists’, economists’ work. AUCA also gives a unique opportunity for students who need financial aid, which is Kiva loan. I am applying for Kiva loan, which will cover part of my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chisac 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina es madre soltera. Cuenta con 30 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 2 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando. Se dedica a una tienda de artículos de consumo diario. Inició este negocio vendiendo dulces en la escuela y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y siolicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar mercadería tales como: confite, granos básicos, embutidos, cerales, entre otros. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital mayor y tener una abarrotería.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la producción, comercio y artesanía.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 30-year-old single mother of two children one of which is attending school.  She never went to school.  She has a store selling basic daily consumption staples.  She started the business selling candy at school and to date has three years’ experience.

She organizes a group and requests a loan to buy such goods as: sweets, basic grains, cured meats and cereals, among others.  She hopes in future to have larger capital and a grocery store.  

The other group members work in agriculture, commerce and crafts.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods.

loans.name: Matalau

texts.en: Matalau is a 50-year-old woman, who has never married, with three children. She runs a business selling everyday goods in her community. She has three years of experience in this business. Matalau has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, and rice, a carton of corned beef, tins of fish and boxes of laundry powder. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and support her children's future education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, and rice, a carton of corned beef, tins of fish and boxes of laundry powder.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 26 years old. He lives in Gaza with his family, only one of whom is employed and helping him to support the family.

On May 1, 2010, Mahmoud opened his own barbershop; recently he hired an employee to help him because his customers are continually increasing. He is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair and air conditioner for his shop. This will increase the number of clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair and air conditioner for his shop.

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es: Norma de 21 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su madre y hermana. Norma se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos en casas particulares. De esta forma colabora a la economía de su hogar. Su vivienda es muy humilde pero propia y su deseo es ir mejorándola poco a poco. En la actualidad las paredes del cuarto de la cocina se encuentran dañadas ya que el tiempo, el sol y las lluvias han contribuido al deterioro y no dan el soporte adecuado. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios (lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos), para la reparación. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y dar mayor seguridad a sus pertenencias y familia.
texts.en:
Norma, 21, lives in the family home with her mother and sister.  She works as a domestic employee in private homes.  She contributes to the household economy this way.  

Her house may be humble but it is hers and she wants to make improvements to it gradually.  Currently, the kitchen walls are damaged because as time has passed, sun and rain have worn them down and they no longer provide the necessary support.  This is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy the necessary building supplies (galvanized metal sheets, lumber and nails) to do the repairs.  She hopes to get this support and provide more security to her family and to her belongings.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 62 años de edad y habita junto a su madre quien depende de sus cuidados desde hace 2 años. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como: vestidos, faldas, pantalones, blusas, etc. En el negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y gracias a su buen servicio cuenta con muchos clientes. Su deseo es poder mejorar el corredor de su vivienda ya que como se puede apreciar en la fotografía está deteriorado y necesita un cambio. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo del corredor ya que cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así hacer los cambios necesarios.
texts.en:
Santos, 62, lives with her mother who has been dependent on her for the last two years.  She works manufacturing articles of clothing like dresses, skirts, pants, blouses, etc.  The business is located at home and thanks to the good service she has many customers.

Her wish is to be able to make improvements to her house because as can be seen in the photo, the roof over the front patio is deteriorated and needs to be repaired.  She’s asking FUSAI for this loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, lumber and nails to replace the roof because it leaks when it rains.  She hopes to get this support to make the necessary changes.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 46ans à un électricien. Elle a 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 21ans et le dernier 1an dont deux sont à l’école. Elle est revendeuse dans la vente et l’achat de charbons et de poissons frits à tous clients à la maison. Elle demande son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour réinvestir dans l’activité de vente et d’achat de charbons et de poissons frits. Elle espère agrandir son activité et assurer l’avenir de ses enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 2003.
texts.en: Abla is a 46-year-old woman married to an electrician. She has four children, of whom the oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is 1. Two of the children are in school. Abla is a vendor buying and selling charcoal and fried fish to all comers to her house. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to reinvest in her commerce in charcoal and fried fish. She hopes to expand her business and ensure her children's future. She has been operating her business since 2003.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and fish to sell

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en: Sarah Jean is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at Stella Maris College. Her parents earn a small amount from her father's barbecue stand while her mother is a house helper. She has four siblings; they helped in their parents' business, especially on weekends, to earn more income for the family. This semester, she needs to buy school materials and books. Sarah Jean joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is hopeful of finishing her studies and supporting the family needs in the near future.

loans.use: to buy school materials and books for the first semester

loans.name: Adefe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Adefe works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling Avon products. Adefe is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business like sugar, rice, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Adefe has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business like sugar, rice, spices, etc

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives in a rental house that has piped water, but no electricity.

He has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan, he wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia de 33 años de edad,  solo estudio cuarto grado, ya que cuando tenía la edad que podía asistir a clases estaba el conflicto armado lo que no le permitió estudiar más. Ella es acompañada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos. Los hijos que tienen aún, viven con ellos y están estudiando; la primera estudia primer año de bachillerato, la segunda estudia séptimo grado y el último estudia tercer grado.

Otilia se dedica a la elaboración, comercialización de artesanías como matatas, carteras, bolsones, Pulseras y aritos. Tiene ya 3 años de  dedicarse a esta actividad, aprendió  este trabajo porque, asistió a un taller donde se enseñaba todas estas manualidades, dicho proyecto fue impulsado por fomilenio; empezó haciendo unos pocos productos los cuales se le terminaban rápido con la llegada de turistas al lugar donde vive y fue así como se motivó a engrandecer su negocio.  Los productos los elabora  en su casa y enseguida los lleva al negocio que está ubicado en el centro de la comunidad, queda a 300 metros de su casa.  Vende de 8 a 5 pm. Tres días a la semana. Antes de dedicarse a las artesanías vendía productos por catálogo, del cual obtenía sus ingresos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  hilo para las matatas y bolsones, espelma, pita para adornar las diademas. El préstamo le ayudara, porque podrá comprar de una vez toda la materia prima ya que comprando por separado se le hace más difícil, porque le sale más caro y deja de comprar otros artículos para el hogar.

Uno de sus sueños es ampliar su negocio. En cuanto a la familia, pretende que sus hijos estudien de ser posible  a nivel superior y puedan  ser profesionales y  tener así  una vida tranquila, con las comodidades que una familia necesita. 

Todo esto lo hará por medio de las ganancias que le genere el negocio, su negocio lo ampliara construyendo un local, ya que donde vende actualmente lo comparte con otras compañeras.
texts.en:
Otilia is 33 years old and only studied as far as fourth grade, since when she was of school age there was the armed conflict which stopped her from studying further. She has a partner and he works in agriculture growing basic grains. Their children still live with them and are studying; the oldest daughter is in the first year of college, the second daughter is in 7th grade and their son is in third grade.

Otilia earns a living making and selling crafts such as hemp bags, handbags, purses, bracelets and earrings. She has now been doing this for 3 years. She learnt how to do this because she attended a workshop where all of these craft techniques were being taught. This project was promoted by Fomilenio. She started by making a few products which sold out quickly with the arrival of tourists in the area where she lives and so she was encouraged to increase her business. She makes the products at home and then takes them to the business which is situated in the centre of the community, 300 metres from her house. She sells from 8am to 5pm, 3 days a week. Before selling crafts she used to sell products from catalogues and this is how she made a living.

The loan Otilia is asking for is to buy hemp fabric for bags and purses, wax, and hemp fibre for decorating hairbands. The loan will help her because she will be able to buy all of her materials in one go. When she has to buy items separately it makes it more difficult as it works out more expensive and this stops her from buying other items for the home.

One of her dreams is to expand her business. As far as the family goes, she hopes her children will be able to study in higher education and become professionals so they won't have any worries in life and will have everything a family needs.

She will do all of this with the profits she gets from her business. She will increase the business by building her own premises, since the place where she sells currently is shared with other women.

loans.use: to buy hemp fabric for bags and purses, wax, and hemp fibre for decorating hairbands.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer que está felizmente casada con José Arias y juntos han procreado 5 hijos los mismos que ya han realizado sus vidas cada uno de forma independiente. Vive en un pequeño departamento que su madre le heredó, con el esfuerzo de  sus padres logró terminar la secundaria  para luego dedicarse a trabajar ya que por falta de recursos económicos se vio obligada a hacerlo para poder sustentar , viven en una casa ubicada en un sector rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi, este lugar es San José de Yanayacu, un sector netamente ganadero, su hogar es muy humilde pese a las grandes necesidades que han pasado son muy unidos entre cada miembro de la familia, Rosa cuida de una hija minusválida, y recibe un bono por parte del Gobierno Nacional con el cual se ayuda para los medicamentos.  Su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más,  a pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella se encarga de todos los quehaceres de su hogar, de su esposo y además es quien administra la economía en su hogar.
Su negocio es la agricultura y crianza de animales menores, tiene un terreno agrícola donde siembra cebolla larga, papas, y todo lo que la tierra le brinda, trabaja de 11 a 12 horas, es una zona agrícola y ganadera, la  gente de esta zona vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. Rosa solicita un préstamo para poder comprar semillas y herramientas para hacer un mejor trabajo en su terreno. 
Rosa y su familia quieren agradecer de todo corazón a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Rosa is happily married to José Arias. Together, they have 5 children who are each living their lives independently. They live in a small apartment willed to them by her mother. With the support of her parents, she was able to finish secondary school but, after that, she needed to work to support her family due to a lack of economic resources.

Their home is located in a rural sector of the province of Cotopaxi called San José de Yanayacu, which is primarily a farming community. Their home is very humble due to the great needs that they have experienced. Their family is very united.

Rosa takes care of her disabled daughter and receives vouchers from the national government that help pay for her medications. Her small business has continued to grow. Even though she has a job that demands a lot of time and effort, she completes all of the household tasks, cares for her husband, and also manages her household's finances.

Her business is agriculture and raises small animals. She has a plot of land where she grows green onions, potatoes, and everything else that the land provides to her. She works from 11 to 12 hours per day.
 
Since the area is a farming and ranching area, the people support themselves day to day with these activities. Even though it is far from the city, there are families that work in many different areas to support themselves and their community.

Rosa requests this loan to purchase seeds and tools to perform her job better. Rosa and her family would like to thank Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador and Kiva with all of her heart for making it possible for her to grow in her work and personal life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and tools for her crops.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucía de 51 años de edad habita junto a su esposo de en casa propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su comunidad. Es muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora emprendedora y responsable. Su principal patrimonio es su vivienda que poco a poco y con grandes sacrificios ha logrado construir junto a su esposo. En esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para un pequeño cuarto que han construido dentro de su propiedad. No cuenta con el dinero para la inversión pero si cuenta con la capacidad y moral de pago para adquirir un crédito. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar puertas y ventanas de su cuarto y dar mayor seguridad al mismo.
texts.en:
Lucía, 51, has lived with her husband in her own house for many years.  She works selling vegetables in the local market.  She’s known for being a very hardworking, enterprising, responsible woman.  Her main asset is her house that with much sacrifice she has gradually been building with her husband.

On this occasion she wants to buy windows and doors for a small room they’ve built on their property. She does not have money for this investment but does have the capacity and payment history to get a loan.  This is why she’s asking FUSAI for this loan to buy doors and windows for the room to provide it with more security.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Cesar Donald

texts.es: Casar tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre quien depende de sus cuidados ya que por la edad no le es posible  trabajar. Tiene 15 años de habitar en su vivienda que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado ir mejorando.  Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer cambio del techo ya que se encuentra quebrado y además desea terminar de poner el techo de la cocina que por la falta de presupuesto no logro terminar.  Él trabaja en la alcaldía de su comunidad como obrero de proyectos y así logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera que son los materiales necesarios para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cesar, 19, lives in his own house with his mother who because of her age is no longer able to work and is totally dependent on his care.  He’s lived in his house for 15 years and with much effort has managed to make improvements to it.  

He’s asking FUSAI for a loan to replace the roof because it’s broken and he also wants to finish installing the kitchen roof which was left unfinished for lack of funds.

He works as a laborer on city hall projects and supports his home this way.  He’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails and lumber which are the necessary materials to repair the roof at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida de 38 años de edad, habita en casa propia desde hace 7 años junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, dos de los cuales dependen de ella. Junto a su compañero de vida mantienen  la economía de su hogar. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos por catálogo en las diferentes zonas de su comunidad. Desea hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda, una de ellas es asegurar las ventanas con balcones de hierro, y la otra es mejorar el piso del corredor. Para esto solicita a FUSAI un  crédito  para invertir en la compra de cemento, balcones para ventana,  ladrillo de piso, etc.  Tiene la seguridad de contar con la capacidad de responder a dicho compromiso.
texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old.  She has lived in her own home for 7 years together with her family.  This consists of her life partner, and their three children, two of which are dependent on her.  

She maintains the economy of their home with her partner.  She works selling catalog products in different areas of her community. She would like to make some improvements to her home.  One of these is to secure the windows with iron on the balconies, and the other is to improve the floor of the corridor.  For these, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI.  

This loan will help her to buy cement, window balconies, brick floors, etc.  You can be assured that she can repay the loan installments and meet her obligation.

loans.use: to buy: cement, window balconies, brick floors, and to make the necessary improvements to her home.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including chips, soft drinks, canned goods and egg noodles. Aida has been in this business for 10 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling pigs. She has sustained her business through her hard work and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Nora Lourdesita

texts.en:
Nora Lourdesita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

Nora Lourdesita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Nora Lourdesita has been in this business for 27 years now.

In the future, Nora Lourdesita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jesus Amelia

texts.es:
Jesus es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus 2 hijas, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jesus no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Jesus trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará alimento balanceado y apropiado para sus cuyes, de esta manera Jesus espera aumentar la cantidad de cuyes para ampliar sus ventas, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 48 year old woman.  She lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Guadalupe, with her two daughters.  She is a single mother and a hard worker.  All her working efforts go toward moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Jesus could not study toward a professional career.  

Through her own initiative, Jesus works in her small business of raising and selling guinea pigs.  She works every day for approximately 10 hours.  She believes she will do well because of her dedication and effort.  

Jesus is very grateful to Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their financial help and support, she will be able to provide a balanced and appropriate diet for her guinea pigs.  In this way, Jesus expects to increase the quantity of guinea pigs to expand her sales.  

She will continue working and strive to achieve her great dream of seeing her children have good professions.

loans.use: to buy a balanced diet for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a hardworking and enterprising man who operates a clothing business. He sells women's and men's clothes and cites seasonality as his major challenge.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with eleven children. Six of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice and tricycle transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is married and runs an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional abaca to weave. She has been in this business for 19 years and would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional abaca for weaving

loans.name: Myraluna

texts.en:
Myraluna is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Myraluna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Myraluna has been raising pigs for two years now and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Myraluna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a  29-year-old married father of one child who repairs and sells air conditioners and washing machines. He also works on other electrical machines, and has been doing this work for eight years. He is a hard worker. He puts much effort into developing his business to make sure that it will provide him with a good income to cover his family’s and his business' increasing needs. 

Khalil is a Palestinian Refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp like most Palestinians living in Lebanon. Khalil challenge is the lack of customers in the camp since he is limited to a certain area.
 
He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his inventory with special electrical spare parts. He hopes to develop his business and be capable of expanding his working zone in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business by purchasing special electrical spare parts.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 19-year-old student of Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City studying Business Administration. She is a working student because her father has already died and her mother is earning from his work as a caretaker. She was determined to finish her studies and find a job in the future to help her family. This semester, after joining GDMPC, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy books and school materials. She wants to be successful in her studies and find a way to augment their living.

loans.use: to buy books and school materials for the first semester

loans.name: Johana Marielos

texts.es: Johana de 20 años de  edad habita en casa familiar desde hace siete años.  Es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada y responsable. Su objetivo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo que su esposo se vio obligado a emigrar al extranjero para reunir un poco de dinero y sacar adelante a su familia. Con lo poco que recibe en calidad de remesas logra cubrir los gastos alimenticios y servicios básicos (agua y luz eléctrica), su deseo es asegurar su humilde casa con un muro perimetral de tela metálica y postes de cemento. En la actualidad no cuentan con el  efectivo para hacer la inversión, es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios (tela metálica, postes de cemento, etc.). Está segura que con la poca ayuda que recibe podrá  saldar el crédito que está solicitando.
texts.en:
Johana, 20, has lived in the family home for seven years.  She’s a hardworking, dedicated, responsible woman.  Her goal is to improve her living conditions. Her husband had to move abroad to earn money to move the family forward.  With the little she gets from the stipends he sends she’s able to cover food and basic utility (water, electricity) costs.  

She’d like to make her humble home safer with a metal mesh and cement post perimeter wall but does not have cash to make this investment which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy the needed supplies (metal mesh, cement posts, etc.)  She’s sure that with the little help she gets she’ll be able to repay the loan she’s requesting.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus hijos. Ella se dedica al trabajo doméstico, y sus hijos trabajan y aportan en la economía del hogar. Ella es muy dedicada a su familia y busca las formas de dar mejores condiciones de vida. Su principal patrimonio es su vivienda que con muchos esfuerzos y a la ayuda que recibe de sus hijos ha logrado levantar. Desea  terminar el cerco  perimetral de su vivienda el cual  está hecho de tela metálica y postes de cemento con el fin de darle seguridad a su familia y pertenencias.  Debido a lo anterior, solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para comprar tela metálica y postes de cemento para poder terminar de asegurar su casita. Espera poder contar con dicha ayuda  y así lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María, 43, is a single mother living with her children in a house she owns.  She’s a domestic employee and her children work and contribute to household economy.  She’s very devoted to her family and always seeks ways to improve their quality of life.  

Her main asset is her house that with much effort and with her children’s help she’s managed to build.  She’d like to finish the perimeter fence made of metal mesh and cement posts to protect her family and her belongings.  

Because of this she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy metal mesh and cement posts to finish securing her house.  She hopes to get this support to thus reach her objective.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Jose Jacobo

texts.es:
El señor José es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de gallinas desde hace 5 años, los cuales sale a vender los viernes en su comunidad y en los barrios cercanos a la misma.
Don José está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de gallinas para revenderlas ya que necesita seguir realizando su negocio. El espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con el producto necesario para seguir satisfaciendo los pedidos de sus clientes, además desea que sus ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que ayuden a mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia. 
Don José espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
José is a hardworking and honest person who lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  He lives with his two children.  He has worked in the business of buying and selling of chickens for 5 years. He sells them on Fridays in his community and in nearby neighborhoods.  

José is requesting this loan to buy chickens for resale because he needs to continue running his business.  He hopes that this loan will help a lot since he needs more products to continue meeting customer standards.  He also hopes to increase sales and with that, help improve his and his family's lifestyle.  

José hopes to expand his business and continue to support his children in their studies. This way, they can have better opportunities in their lives.  


Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy chickens for his business

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Yim is 61 years old, married, and the mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She has earned a living growing rice and planting cassava for 32 years. She and her husband can earn about KHR 13,000 per day from the current business, and can save about KHR 5,000 each day for future needs. 

This will be Yim's second loan with VisionFund, her previous one having helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor fees. Yim hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar: esposo quien es agricultor y sus dos hijas de 18 y 13 años de edad. Es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia. Todos los días se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chocolate de forma artesanal dentro de las principales zonas de su comunidad. Además, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.  Para ella lo más importante es que su querida familia viva cómoda y en buenas condiciones.  Desde hace varios días ha visto la necesidad de hacer el cambio del techo de la cocina ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias se ha deteriorado y el agua se filtra lo cual daña sus pocas pertenencias. Además,  desea levantar una pared de un cuarto. Por lo anterior solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada,  clavos y madera  y así poder darle el mantenimiento necesario a su  vivienda.
texts.en: María is 55 years old and lives in her own house with her family - her husband - a farmer -, and their two daughters, who are aged 18 and 13 years old.  María is an enterprising and hard-working woman, and is very dedicated to her family.  Every day María works making and selling artisan chocolate in various parts of the community.  In addition, at the weekend, she sell used clothing.  For María the most important thing is that her dear family live comfortably and in good conditions.  For a number of years, María has known that there is a need to replace the kitchen roof as, due to the weather and the rains, it ias deteriorated and water comes in.  The water then damages the few belongings the family has.  María also wants to put up a wall so as to create a bedroom.  In order to do this María is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy galvanized laminated sheets, nails, and wood, in order to do the necessary maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminated sheets, nails, and wood, in order to repair her roof and put up a wall.

loans.name: Gloria Lissette

texts.es: Gloria de 29 años de edad  habita junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad en casa propia desde hace 8 años. Ella se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de chocolate de forma artesanal dentro de su hogar. Es muy conocida en su comunidad por ser una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable.  Junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar y tratan de brindar las mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo. Dentro de su vivienda no cuenta con agua potable y además el techo de su hogar se encuentra totalmente deteriorado lo cual es necesario repararlo lo antes posible. Solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poner el agua potable  y comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para cambiar el techo de su humilde hogar.
texts.en: Gloria is 29 years old and lives with her partner and four-year-old son.  Gloria has lived in this, her own house, for eight years.  Gloria makes a living making and selling artisan chocolate from her home.  Gloria is very well-known in her community for being a hard-working, enterprising and responsible woman.  Alongside her partner, Gloria is able to support the household and together the are trying to improve their son's living conditions.  The house does not have running water and the roof is completely deteriorated.  As a result, Gloria needs to repair it as sson as possible.  Gloria is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to install running water, and to buy galvanized laminate sheets, nails, and wood, in order to replace the roof of her humble home.

loans.use: to install running water, and to buy galvanized laminate sheets, nails, and wood, in order to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Karla Marina

texts.es: Karla tiene 24 años de edad y es madre soltera de una niña de 9 años de edad.  Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado mantener a su pequeña hija que cada día le demanda más. Karla es empleada de un pequeño hotel fuera de su comunidad desde hace dos años.  Su deseo es dar a su hija mejores condiciones, por lo tanto ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su humilde casa en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto. Por lo anterior solicita a FUSAI  este crédito para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para la construcción. Espera contar con dicha ayuda  que le permita cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Karla, 24, is a single mother of a nine-year-old girl.  With much effort and work she’s been able to support her daughter whose needs increase more every day.  

Karla has worked in a small hotel outside her community for two years.  Her wish is to provide better conditions for her daughter which is why she’s decided to add a room to her house.  

To do so, she’s asked FUSAI for this loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, lumber and nails to build it.  She hopes to get this support that will help her reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Silvia Lisseth

texts.es: Silvia de 23 años de edad habita en casa familiar desde hace 6 años.  Se caracteriza por ser una joven emprendedora, trabajadora y responsable.  Silvia se dedica al procesamiento de lácteos tales como queso, crema y requesón. De esta forma logra aportar a la economía de su hogar. Su vivienda es muy humilde pero poco a poco va haciendo mejoras junto a su familia. En esta ocasión ha decidido cambiar el piso  ya que por el momento es de tierra, además desea reforzar las vigas del techo de su casa que con el tiempo se han deteriorado. Solicita a FUSAI este crédito para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso y polines para hacer las mejoras antes mencionadas. Confía poder contar con esta ayuda y cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Silvia, 23, has lived in the family home for six years.  She’s noted for being an enterprising, hardworking, responsible young woman.  Silvia works processing dairy products like cheese, cream and cottage cheese.  She contributes to the family economy this way.

Her house is very humble but she and her family have been gradually making improvements to it.  On this occasion, they want to replace the floor which is dirt and would also like to reinforce the roof beams which have deteriorated over time.

She’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, paving stones and roof purlins to make the above mentioned improvements.  She hopes to get this help and to reach her objective.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Paula Del Carmen

texts.es: Paula de 49 años de edad, habita junto a su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar y sus dos hijas de 9 y 15 años de edad. Paula se gana la vida trabajando en casa en la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace muchos años. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y su deseo es poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida. Junto a su compañero de vida han logrado construir una humilde casa. Desea mejorar el piso del corredor de su vivienda ya que por el momento es de tierra.  Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, cemento y ladrillo de piso para hacer las mejoras necesarias y dar a sus hijas condiciones más saludables e higiénicas.
texts.en:
Paula is 49 and lives together with her common-law husband, who helps her with the household expenses, and their two daughters, who are 9 and 15. She has earned her living for many years by working at home providing domestic services. For her, what is most important is her family, and her wish is to be able to provide them with better living conditions.

Together with her partner they have been able to construct a modest house. She wishes to improve the floor in the passageway in her house, because at present it is dirt. This is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI, to buy sand, cement and brick flooring in order to make the necessary improvements and give her daughters healthier and cleaner conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks for flooring; her current floor is dirt.

loans.name: Elena Elizabeth

texts.es: Elena tiene 44 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo, hija de 14 años e hijo de 12 años. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de chocolate de forma artesanal dentro de su casa y es así como colabora con la economía de su hogar. Con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda pero no ha logrado finalizarlas ya que no cuenta con los ingresos necesarios para hacerlo por su cuenta. Solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pintura y tres  puertas  para los  cuartos de su casa y poder así hacer las mejoras necesarias para brindar mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Elena is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her family - her husband, 14-year-old daughter, and 12-year old son.  Elena makes a living producing and selling artisan chocolates at home, and this is how she contribute's to the family's finances.  With a lot of effort, Elena has managed to make some improvements to her house, but she has not been able to finish the work as she does not make enough money to do it alone.  Elena is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to invest in buying paint and three doors for the rooms in her house, and in order to make necesssary improvements in order to provide her family with more security.

loans.use: to buy paint and three doors for the rooms of her house, in order to have more privacy.

loans.name: Jedelyn

texts.en:
Jedelyn is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jedelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, spices, cream, etc.

Jedelyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, spices, cream, etc.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora María habita en Managua, es madre de un hijo de 17 años de edad, a quien tuvo que educar sola hasta donde alcanzaron sus recursos económicos, ya que ella se quedo viuda desde hace ya un tiempo. Dora trabaja de operaria largas jornadas en una zona franca, su hijo le apoya con la comercialización de tomate en un mercado de la ciudad y juntos luchan por salir adelante. Ella solicita el crédito para concluir las paredes del lado derecho su casa de habitación, necesitando para esto comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, madera, arena entre otros.
texts.en:
Dora María lives in Managua.  She was widowed some time ago.  She’s mother of a 17-year-old son who she had to educate to the extent that her resources allowed.

Dora works long shifts in a tax-free zone.  Her son helps her sell tomatoes in the city market and they struggle together to get ahead. 

She needs the loan to finish building the walls on the right side of her house.  She needs to buy building supplies like cement, iron rods, concrete blocks, lumber and sand, among others.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is an energetic young person and is a  working student in Stella Maris College, Oroquieta City. She is studying Business Administration. She is 25 years old and lives with her parents. In her free time, she find ways to make additional earnings.

Analie needs to buy books and school materials for her first semester.   That's why she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro finance. She wants to be successful in the future.

loans.use: buy books and school materials

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida is a 25-year-old single man who has been working in the aluminum business for 7 years.  He is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing  his business to make sure that it will provide him with a good income that’s enough to to cover his and his family’s needs. 

At the beginning, Rida lacked customers, but he proved to be skilled in his domain and attracted a good number who are his main working base to plan for future expansion and development.

Rida is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a specialized machine for aluminum to expand and develop his working sector.

loans.use: buy a machine for aluminum work

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorretti is a single mother of four children who all go to school. She also takes care of grandchildren. She operates a kiosk (canteen) at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of  1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy biscuits, Irish potato crisps, sweet bananas, sweets, and other snacks. Her major business challenges are that her fruits are perishable and seasonality. She is aspiring to expand her kiosk into a big shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, Irish potato crisps, sweet bananas,sweets and other snacks.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase canned goods, energen, noodles, soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Dominga has been in this business for 3 years.  She also earns more income from nipa roofing making.

Dominga has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 44 years old and married with two children.

Rosalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Rosalia aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 60 years old.  She is a widow with three children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets and feeds.  She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Salvacion is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 34 years old and married.  She has four children who are all in school. Virgie works very hard to provide for them.

Virgie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virgie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as candies, soap, sugar and other goods. 

In the future, Virgie would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase hot dogs, chorizo, chicken, meat, sticks and other ingredients for her barbecue business.

Alma has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase hot dogs, chorizo, chicken, meat, sticks and other ingredients for her barbecue business

loans.name: Toy

texts.en:
Toy is a 44-year-old married mother of three children living in the Trang district of Takeo province.  She does rice planting and has 22 years experiences in this business.  She is able to earn up to 5 USD per day and keeps 2 US dollars each day as savings.

Toy joins VisionFund Kiva’s partner this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family, thereby she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition

loans.name: Tith's Group

texts.en:
Tith is 45 years old and married.  He is a rural villager from the Sampov Meas district. He has four dependent children and three of them are studying while one is still too young for school. He makes a living through planting pineapples. Having been in this business for almost 10 years, he currently can earn about 23,000 KHR per day. 

This is the microloan for Tith’s group of two and they are the first-cycle clients.  Tith is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund.   He will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income to make their living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man who is very hardworking and enterprising.   For the past two years he has operated a green grocery shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high competition from other green groceries. He dreams of establishing a fruits parlour in the future.

With the loan that he is requesting, Patrick wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra’s husband owns a motorbike repairing workshop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. His residence is near to the shop as well. His workshop is situated beside a large and reputed spare parts shop.   Mostly, customers like to fix their motorbike parts from the other workshop due to their large variety of spare parts. Azra does not have a large variety of spare parts to offer and attract customers for repairing motorbikes. 

To grow his business and income and to compete, Azra's husband made a plan to offer more varieties of spare parts and the latest repairing tools.  Therefore, Azra requested a loan to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more varieties of spare parts and the latest repairing tools as well.

Azra is 47 years old and is the mother of 5 children.  She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a farmer, and is the mother of two children who are already working and have their own families. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the farm. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Anita operates a dalandan (Philippine orange) farm. She grows the fruit on their farm located in Cavite. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 9000 in sales each month. 

Curiously, dalandan has been called "sweet orange" or "sour orange" in English. In the Philippines, the flesh is orange while the skin is green and thin enough to be easily peeled off with the fingers. The fruit is peeled and eaten by Filipinos, usually with a bit of rock salt if it is sour, and dalandan juice is popular drink in the Philippines.

To help Anita continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go for the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Anita dreams to expand her business and help her children through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening. Lolita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo for her general store business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy, 41 years old, is a married mother of three children and lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 10 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
Navy is borrowing from VisionFund for the first time, leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. Navy will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José, a sus 39 años de edad es padre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar desde la separación con su esposa. Durante muchos años trabajó en un taller de reparación de radios y televisores en el municipio donde residía, pero, para aprovechar la oportunidad que le estaba dando el dueño del taller, él decidió quedarse con el negocio y, con la experiencia y el conocimiento adquirido pasó de ser empleado a propietario del establecimiento, sin embargo, no le estaba yendo muy bien, por lo que decidió trasladarse para otro municipio y montar nuevamente el negocio y ahora tiene la ventaja de no poseer tanta competencia en el nuevo sitio de ubicación; de esta manera ha generado los recursos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia durante los 8 años que lleva realizando su labor como independiente. Su empuje, empeño y positivismo lo han llevado a sobrepasar las dificultades que se le han presentado, y siempre ha sabido salir adelante motivado por sus hijos. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para reparación de equipos de sonido y televisores, de esta forma podrá tener los recursos necesarios para cumplir con la demanda de servicio, dando como resultado un incremento favorable en los ingresos familiares. José desea seguir trabajando arduamente para poder cumplir el sueño de montar un almacén de electrodomésticos en un local propio y, así tener una estabilidad económica para dar a sus hijos una buena educación y un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
José, 39, is father of two children and head of household since separating from his wife.  He worked in an electronics repair shop in his community for many years repairing radios and television sets.  However, availing himself of an opportunity the shop’s owner was offering, he decided to take over the business and with the experience and skills he’d acquired passed from being an employee to being the owner of the establishment.
