However, he wasn’t doing too well so he decided to move to another town and set up the business again and now he has the advantage of having less competition in his new location which has led to his being able to generate enough income to support his family during the 8 years he’s been working independently.  His drive, effort and positive outlook have led him to overcome the difficulties that have arisen and he’s always been able to get ahead motivated by his children.

At present, he’s requesting a loan to buy spare parts to repair sound equipment and television sets.  In this way, he’ll be able to have the necessary resources to meet service requests which will result in a favorable increase in family income.

José wants to continue working hard to reach his dream of opening a home appliance store in a locale of his own to attain economic stability and to provide his children with a good education and improved well-being.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in the Litein area of Kenya, a very fertile area. He has two children and has been doing this work for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy farming." His biggest challenge is the "lack of more financial resources to expand business." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Erick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "There is training of farmers." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "They help them with finance for their development."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Erick replied that it will "improve their living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Erick owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, running water" but does not have "electricity, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a 23-year-old married lady who has been working selling beauty cosmetics and accessories for a year. She started her own business to help her husband in planning for a better future for their small family.

Reem is a hard worker, and is well known in her region for a good reputation and the special products she provides to her customers with encouraging prices.

Today Reem is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to make sure that she'll be capable of responding to customers different needs. She will increase her business merchandise with newly released autumn and winter collection.

Reem will keep on working hard to expand her business to support her husband, and to satisfy her customers needs properly.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released autumn and winter collection

loans.name: Jenevieve

texts.en:
Jenevieve is living with her parents in Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. Her father is a fisherman, their main source of income, while her mother sells fish in the market to earn a living. 

She is studying Health Care (Nursing Aide) at C-lan Institute of Technology. She joined GDMPC and took a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. 

Her future plans are to find a job related to her course, and become successful with her own family.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Meggie

texts.en:
Meggie is a married woman who works hard for her daily life.  Meggie has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With this KSH 30,000 Meggie wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mony's Group

texts.en:
Mony, 62, lives with her husband in a rural village in Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Mony makes a living by working as a tailor. Engaging in this business for 36 years, she is able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is Mony’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group has only two members. Mony has been with VisionFund for seven cycles.  She has used the previous loans to improve her family’s livelihood.  

Mony is now leading this group to apply for another loan with VisionFund.  She is going to use her portion to buy household supplies to use in her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough household materials for using in her family.

loans.use: buy household supplies for her family

loans.name: Oka

texts.en:
Oka is a 44-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small business fishing and selling fish in her community.  She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Oka has requested a loan to buy fishing line, fish hooks, spears and goggles. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Oka will support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: buy fishing line, fish hooks, spears and goggles.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is an energetic young woman who is studying Health Care (Nursing Aid) at the C-Lan Institute of Technology in Misamis Occidental. She has 9 siblings, some are already with their own family. Her father is  a government employee while her mother earns income in the charcoal making business. Merly worked as a waitress in her free time in to earn additional income. 

Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services, as she needs assistance in order to finish her courses. She borrowed a loan of  PHP 14,000 to pay her school tuition fee for the first semester. She is hopeful to find success in her future life to have a better living.

loans.use: pay college tuition

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is single and has three children.  All her children go to school.  Florence operates a retail shop from the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on both retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for 6 years and works seven days a week.  She also gets additional income from selling piped water. 

Florence has applied for a loan of  UGX 1,800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sodas, eggs, sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and boxes of soap. She is aspiring of building rental houses. 

Florence resides in a family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Don Javier es una persona honesta y trabajadora  el vive en una comunidad hacia el sur de Honduras junto con el viven su esposa y sus 3 hijas. Su negocio compra y venta de ganado y leña desde hace 10 años, los cuales vende en su comunidad y en los caseríos cercanos la misma. 
Don Javier necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser ganado y así cubrir la demanda que tiene de sus clientes. Espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho y le genere un aumento en las ventas y de esta manera ganar mas ingresos que vengan a beneficiar su estilo de vida y el de de su familia en el hogar.
Don Javier espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y que así puedan cumplir sus sueños y  tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Javier is an honest, hardworking man living with his wife and three daughters in a community in southern Honduras.  His business for the last ten years has been buying and selling cattle and firewood in his community and in surrounding districts.

Javier needs a loan to buy more cattle to meet customer demand.  He hopes the loan will be very useful and that it will lead to more sales so he can earn higher income to improve his and his family’s lifestyle at home.

Javier hopes to increase business and continue supporting his children’s schooling so they can reach their dreams and have greater opportunities in the future.



Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2013

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 54 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Rosenda is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds.  She has been raising pigs for 34 years and also earns additional income from weaving.

Rosenda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 27 years old, married and has four children, three of her children are in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins.

Mary Grace has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 4 children and has been doing farming work for 8 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea.

Annah stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is: 'Returns!'   Her biggest challenge is 'lack of enough capital.'   Annah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it gives farmers incentives.'  She was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  She replied: 'how to develop a savings culture.'   Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Annah replied 'Better living.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Annah owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household:  'mosquito net, electricity, TV' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: build a greenhouse

loans.name: Khurshid

texts.en:
Khurshid is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and 5 children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop in which he sells precious stones for artificial jewelry and bridal dresses. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  

Khurshid's husband has only one source of income.  He has to pay the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children and household expenses alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living and he wants to construct a new house.   For this purpose, more earnings are required so that he can save some money for the construction.

Therefore, Khurshid requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can increase his inventory and earnings as well.  She hopes that they will construct this house soon because she has to marry her elder son so that he can pass his life comfortably.

Khurshid is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: buy artificial gems to sell

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman with two children who are adults. She lives in her own house.

For the past five years, she has operated a business of selling Leso (a woman's wrap) cloth, and women's clothes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase 40 pieces of Leso’s and women's clothes to sell. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of Leso’s and women clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Isabeth

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad,  no estudio por eso no sabe leer ni escribir, ella es casada, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y de jornalero, ellos tienen 2 hijos que viven en su casa,  uno de ellos tiene 20 años, quien no estudia ni trabaja por poseer una discapacidad, la niña estudia primer año de bachillerato en el Instituto Nacional.

 María se dedica a la agricultura, desde que estaba pequeña, sus padres le inculcaron a aprender a cultivar la tierra en la siembra de maíz y de frijol; como su familia era de escasos recursos económicos solo se dedicaban a cultivar la tierra y no realizaban otra actividad, aparte de cultivar la tierra María se dedica a elaborar pan horneado para venderlo en su comunidad y para llegar al lugar de cultivo, está a una distancia de 1 kilometro y tiene que caminar 20 minutos para realizar sus actividades en el cultivo. De su familia recibe el apoyo de su esposo,  para trabajar en la agricultura y su hija que también le apoya. El horario de trabajo no es estable, ellos pueden realizar las actividades el tiempo que sea necesario. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  2 sacos de abono  para suministrarle a su cultivo y también el transporte de carga del abono, ellos obtendrán mejores cosecha para el resto de la época seca y les garantiza que no se quedaran sin suministros básicos en su familia.

Desea, aumentar la producción agrícola y también la producción de pan, tener una mejor calidad de vida, y una mejor casa.  De sus hijos espera que sean personas de bien, que su hija pueda sacar una carrera universitaria y que sean serviciales en su comunidad.
texts.en:
María, 42, never went to school so doesn’t know how to read or write.  She’s married and her husband works in agriculture and as a day laborer.  They have two children living at home.  One of them is 20-years-old and he’s disabled so neither attends school nor works.  Their daughter attends first year of high-school at the Instituto Nacional.

María has worked in agriculture since she was little; her parents taught her how to work the land and grow corn and beans.  Since her family was of scarce economic resources they only worked the land and did no other activity.

In addition to working the land, María also bakes bread to sell in her community.  To reach her fields that are a kilometer away to do her agricultural chores she must take a 20-minute walk.  Her husband helps her do the agricultural work and her daughter helps out too.  Her work schedule isn’t fixed; they do the work whenever it’s necessary.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy two sacks of manure for the crops and also to pay to transport the manure.  They will obtain a better harvest to last through the dry season which will guarantee that they won’t run out of basic supplies for the family.

She wants to increase both her agricultural output and the bread production to improve her quality of life and to have a better house.  Her hopes for her children is that they will become upstanding citizens, that her daughter is able to complete a university career and that they are of service to their community.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of manure and to pay for their transport.

loans.name: Jimmy Henrry

texts.es:
Jimmy es un hombre de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jimmy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Jimmy trabaja como chofer de mototaxi brindando servicios de transporte y adicionalmente en la mañana pela pollos en una avícola,el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jimmy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada terminará la construcción de una habitación para sus hijos, de esta manera brindara mayor seguridad y  bienestar para su familia, así pues Jimmy seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Jimmy, 31, lives in Ica with his wife and two children.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to go to work, Jimmy was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Jimmy works as a mototaxi driver providing transportation services and is also employed mornings on a chicken farm butchering chickens.  He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks he does well because of his dedication and his effort.

Jimmy’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to finish building a bedroom for his children providing them with increased security and family well-being.  Jimmy will continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a transportation firm.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucia de estado civil soltera. Con 26 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela. Se dedica la confección de prendas como Playeras y Pants. Inició este negocio trabajando como empleada y a la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materia prima como: tela, hilos, agujas, etc. En el futuro desea contar con mas maquinas y tener empleados para poder producir por mayor.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir. 

El compañero no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Lucia, 26, is single and did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She works as a seamstress and makes beachwear and pants.  She started her business as an employee and has six years' experience.

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.  In the future she hopes to have more sewing machines and employees so she can produce wholesale products.

The other members of the group also work in the sewing business.

One of the members was unable to be present for the photo.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Yndaura

texts.es:
Yndaura tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, a quienes quiere  mucho y por los cuales trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para darles una vida digna, Yndaura trabaja en el municipio de su ciudad en el área de jardines; Yndaura cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable. 

Yndaura esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para construir una pared para dar seguridad en su  vivienda, de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando con mayor tranquilidad y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Yndaura, 40, is the mother of four children who she loves very much and works hard for so they will have a decent lifestyle.  She works for the city in the municipal park area.  She believes she is doing well in her job because she is responsible.

Yndaura is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy construction materials to build a wall around her house for more security.  This will allow her to continue working with more peace of mind while striving toward her goal of giving her son a career.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nemesio De Jesus

texts.es: Nemesio de Jesús habita en Managua y ha hecho un gran empeño por mantener su trabajo de conductor privado de una familia, su esposa quien lo ayuda con las actividades domesticas del  hogar ha sido su gran apoyo. Don Nemesio ha venido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, pero aun le falta establecer mejores condiciones sanitarias para su familia y la comunidad. Él solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción, con el cual edificará una fosa séptica en el patio de su casa, ya que por su barrio aun no está terminado el proyecto de aguas negras; los materiales básicos para la construcción serán: piedras canteras, piedrín, cemento, hierro y arena.
texts.en: Nemesio de Jesús lives in Managua and works hard to continue his job as a private driver for a family.  His wife is a homemaker and has been his greatest support.  Nemesio has been carrying out home renovations but still needs to work on improving the sanitary conditions for the family and the community.  He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a septic tank in the patio of his house because the neighborhood does not have a sewage project in place yet.  The basic materials he needs are: quarry stone, gravel, cement, iron and sand.

loans.use: To buy quarry stone, gravel, cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El señor Santos es una persona honesta y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos.  Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de pan desde hace 5 años, el cual vende dese su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante en los distintos caseríos cercanos a su comunidad. 
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser harina, huevos, manteca, azúcar, levadura, sal, etc. materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus panes.
Don Santos espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda a su negocio para poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia. Desea que un futuro su negocio siga creciendo y  convierta en una panadería reconocida y generadora de empleo y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia a cumplir sus metas y sueños como el de que sus hijos terminen los estudios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Santos is an honest, hard-working person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with his wife and three children.  He has been making and selling bread for five years.  He works at home and sells his products as a street vendor in the rural areas near his community.  Santos is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials such as flour, eggs, shortening, sugar, yeast, salt, etc. which he needs to make bread.

Santos hopes this investment will be of great help to his business so he can earn enough income to support his family.  He hopes to expand the business in the future and turn it into a renowned bakery which can generate employment.  This will allow him to continue supporting his family and to reach his goals of seeing his children finish their education.



Choluteca, Honduras - September, 2013

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, shortening, sugar, yeast, salt, etc. for his bakery.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con su hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Maria no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Maria trabaja como costurera,confeccionando y componiendo de prendas de vestir, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una maquina de coser industrial, la cual le servirá de mucho para su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, lives in the city of Piura in the district of Jayanca with her son.  She is a single, working mother who dedicates all her efforts to providing for her family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and the need to work, Maria was unable to get professional training.

On her own initiative, Maria works as a seamstress.  She works every day approximately ten hours and believes things are going well for her because of her dedication and hard work.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy an industrial sewing machine which will help her business greatly.  It will allow her to continue working and striving toward her goal of having a large sewing shop.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Freedeslinda

texts.es:
Freedeslinda tiene 58 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Jayanca y es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Freedeslina es una mujer luchadora, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de compra y venta de productos agrícolas, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder solventarse.

Freedeslinda esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más productos como fertilizantes, abono, entre otros con lo cual mejorara sus ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un local propio y que su negocio siga creciendo”.
texts.en:
Freedeslinda, 58, lives in the city of Jayanca; she’s mother of three adult children.  Freedeslinda is a hardworking woman who with much effort succeeded in starting a business buying and selling agricultural supplies earning income from it to support herself.

Freedeslinda’s grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy more products like fertilizer and manure, among others, that will lead to higher income and she will be able to continue working to make her dream reality: to have a locale of her own and that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam, 44, is married with five children, residing in a rural village of the Trang district of Takeo province. Four of her children are dependents and are still in school. 

To support the family, Seam has been farming rice for twenty years. Seam and her husband, together, can earn about USD 19 per day to support the family. 

Seam has been with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles and she completely paid back the past loans. Now, she is applying for another loan to pay for the school fees of her daughter for four years. 

She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in the university to pursue her degree, so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for the school fees of her daughter for four years.

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
María de 30 años de edad, solo estudio primer grado,  es casada, su esposo es agricultor , tiene 6 hijos pero solo 2 viven ya con de ellos, sus hijos estudian en la escuela, la primera estudia sexto grado y la otra estudia quinto grado. Con ella  viven su sobrina y su mamá con quien comparten los oficios de su  hogar.
   
La señora tiene un negocio de elaboración, comercialización  de artesianas , en la cual tiene 5 años de trabajar , una tía trabajaba en lo mismo y ella aprendió un poco ,en seguida recibió un taller sobre lo mismo donde aprendió mas el trabajo y fue como decidió trabar en ello. Ella solo se dedica a esa actividad, pero recibe remesas de USA, antes de ser artesana solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar, hasta donde tiene sus productos esta a 600 metros , por la cercanía se traslada a pie. De su hogar solo ella se dedica  a esa actividad, y trabaja tres días a la semana en el puesto que tiene de 8 am a 5 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 20 conos de hilo, y artesianas ya elaboradas, pintura para hacerle algunos detalles y que sean mas atractivas. Obtener mas ganancias y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia

ella, pretende ampliar su negocio es decir elaborar  mas artículos, y para  su familia que no le falte nada en cuando a necesidades de alimentación, vestuario, vivienda y calzado. Con la ayuda, que recibe de su hijo que tiene en USA, y las ganancias de su negocio  manifiesta que ayudara a sus hijos a que sean profesionales en el futuro y que no vivan limitados por la pobreza como vivió ella anteriormente.
texts.en:
María, 30, only completed first grade.  She’s married and her husband works in agriculture.  She has six children but only two of them still live at home and are attending schoo; the older one is in 6th grade and the other is in 5th.  Her niece and her mother also live with her and share household chores.

Her business is manufacturing and selling crafts.  She’s been working for 5 years.  An aunt has the same occupation and she learned a little from her.  Later on, she got her own workshop and that’s where she learned still more and how she came to work in this.  This is her only activity but she receives stipends from the United States.  Before becoming a craftswoman she did household chores.  The place where she has her products is 600 meters away and she reaches it on foot.  She’s the only one in her home doing this activity.  She works in her stand three days a week from 8am until 5pm.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy 20 cones of thread, ready-made crafts and paint to add some details to them so that they will be more attractive to earn higher profits and provide better quality of life for her family.

She intends to expand the business, that is, to make more items so her family will lack nothing with respect to food, clothing, housing or footwear.  With the help she gets from a son in the USA and profits from her business she states that she’ll help her children become professionals in future so that they won’t live with the limitations poverty imposes like she did in the past.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials.

loans.name: Wiber

texts.es: Wiber es un joven de 20 años de edad, que vive con su madre y sus hermanos menores; realizaba estudios universitarios en el área de economía, pero hace dos años, tras el fallecimiento de su padre tuvo que suspender su carrera y dedicarse a atender el negocio en el que su padre trabajó toda la vida, una distribuidora de sandias y otras frutas, allí labora diariamente durante largas jornadas que comienzan a las 2:00 am y, sus principales clientes son clínicas y hospitales, vendedores ambulantes y algunas heladerías de la ciudad. El cliente manifiesta que este trabajo es muy exigente y requiere mucha atención, pero se motiva por su familia, pues toda la carga económica recae sobre él por ser el mayor y el que tomó las riendas del hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar adecuaciones locativas, pues debe pintar las paredes del negocio y arreglar las rejas exteriores que le brindan seguridad al local, con esto le dará una mejor imagen al local y le beneficiará atrayendo más clientes, pues al tratarse de alimentos las personas son mucho más exigentes en cuanto al aseo y presentación del establecimiento. Todo esto le permitirá seguir luchando por lo que heredó de su padre y tendrá la posibilidad de continuar apoyando a su familia y, espera poder ahorrar para poder culminar con sus estudios universitarios de economía y ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Wiber is a young man 22 years of age, who lives with his mother and younger siblings.  He was studying economics in university, but two years ago, after his father's passing, he had to put his studies on hold and tend to the business in which his father worked his whole life -- a distributor of watermelon and other fruits.  There he works daily, putting in long hours that begin at 2:00am.  

His primary customers are clinics and hospitals, street vendors and some ice cream shops in the city.  He says that this work is very demanding and requires a lot of attention, but he is motivated by his family.  The entire financial burden falls to him for being the oldest, so he holds the reins of the household.

He is currently applying for the loan to carry out some renovations to the store, since he needs to paint the walls of the business and repair the outside bars that provide security to the premises.  This will give the store a better image and will help him by attracting more customers, because when it comes to food, people are much more demanding with regard to cleanliness and the shop's appearance.

All this will help him to continue striving for what he inherited from his father, and he will have the possibility to continue supporting his family.  He hopes to be able to save so that he can finish his university studies in economics and be a professional.

loans.use: to renovate the store, because he needs to paint the walls of the business and repair the outside bars that provide security to the premises.

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en:
Ruby Ann is the daughter of a farmer residing in Talairon, Oroquieta City. She has 5 siblings living with her parents. 

Ruby Ann is studying Health Care (Nursing Aid) at C-lan Institute of Technology. She helped her parents in their farm on weekends to earn extra income. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay the school tuition for the first semester. 

To finish her studies is her goal and she is determined to achieve it. She wants to be successful in her career someday.

loans.use: to pay school tuition for her first semester

loans.name: Canton Calvario V Group

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio Amilcar es soltero. Tiene 18 años de edad. Estudió 2 años de educación secundaria. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para caballeros y niños. Inició este negocio ayudando a su padre en la venta y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo invertira en la compra de mercadería paa surtir su negocio. En esl futuro desea contar con un gran capital de trabajo y tener un local grande y propio en el centro del municipio.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras, crianza de animales domésticos y a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Mauricio Amilcar, 18, is single.  He completed two years of secondary education.  He works selling men’s and children’s clothes.  He started the business helping his father to sell and to date has five years’ experience.

He organizes a group and requests a loan he’ll use to buy merchandise to stock his business.  In future he’d like to have large working capital and to have a large locale of his own in the center of town.

The other group members sell fruit and vegetables, raise domestic animals and sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: La Nueva Unión Group

texts.es:
La señoro Refugio de estado civil casada. De edad 54 años. No curso un año en la escuela. Tiene 6 hijos y los cuales no esta estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos. Inició este negocio por la necesidad de ayudar economicamente a su esposo y a la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá para comprar ovejas, criarlas y luejo venderlas. Desea en el futuro proximo tener una granja. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se decian a la venta de animales domesticos y venta de verduras.
texts.en:
Refugio, 54, is married.  She never went to school.  She has six children none of which are attending school.  She works raising domestic animals.  She started this because she needed to help her husband economically; to date she has 15 years’ experience.

She organizes a group and requests a loan to buy sheep to raise and then sell.  She hopes to own a farm in the near future.

The other group members sell domestic animals and sell vegetables.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 2,1000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Alma has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Susi Leilani

texts.en:
Susi is a 23-year-old woman who is single with no children. She owns a general store where she sells daily consumption goods and pork buns in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Susi has requested a loan to buy a refrigerator, gas oven, bag of flour, cooking oil, yeast and pork meat.

She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, gas oven, bag of flour, cooking oil, yeast and pork meat.

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es: Doña Silvia habita en Managua  y desde hace varios años ha tenido la visión y misión de poder desarrollar con variedad su negocio. La clientela de su actual salón de belleza se ha mantenido, porque es una excelente estilista, ella siempre está pensando en otras fuentes de ingreso que le permitan ahorrar para su etapa de vejez. La amplitud de su casa por la mínima cantidad de personas que la habitan, le permite alquilar pequeñas habitaciones a viajeros, los cuales se hospedan por corto tiempo, dichas habitaciones aun no prestan las condiciones de privacidad. Silvia solicita el crédito para comprar e instalar ventanas de estilo francés, los cuales colocará en las habitaciones de sus futuros clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in Managua and for several years has had the vision and the mission of making her business more diverse.  She’s retained her beauty salon’s clientele because she’s an excellent hairstylist.  

She’s always thinking about alternative sources of income in order to save up for her old age.  Her house is large for the number of people that live in it so it lends itself to have small rooms to rent out to travelers as short-term guests.  These rooms still lack some conditions to insure privacy and Silvia’s asking for the loan to buy and install French-style windows in her future guests’ rooms.

loans.use: to buy and install French-style windows.

loans.name: Cherotich

texts.en:
Cherotich lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Returns earned from selling farm output.' Her biggest challenge is: 'lack of enough capital.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Cherotich was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'they offer their loans at a low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Saving.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked: 'How will this loan benefit her family', Cherotich replied: 'Betterment of their living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cherotich owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity and TV,' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an awning.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze used her previous loan to buy three sacks of coconuts and hired a tractor for her farm. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Kanze is requesting another loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 55 years old and married with two school-age sons and lives in the small village of Tatanaantbuni. David is busy with agricultural activities and grows tomatoes and apples on the family-owned piece of land. He earns a small seasonal income after selling his harvest at the local market. David’s wife, Maryam, is employed at the beauty salon and works as a hair stylist.

Now, David is requesting a small loan to start up his own beauty salon and his wife will work there. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of a business startup and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

David wants to acquire the space and purchase all the needed modern inventories for a hair care business. Maryam will serve the customers as a stylist and generate daily income. According to the couple’s estimates, the business will be lucrative and the increased profit will be reinvested in the same business. 

David and Maryam will be able to improve the living conditions for their children and give them a good education for progressing in life.

loans.use: to start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is single with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a stall of charcoal at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 8 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, and passionfruit. Her major business challenges include transportation and the seasonality of fruits and vegetables. 

She aspires to start growing more vegetables so as to increase her profits, also to become a wholesaler and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita works hard to support her family. Anecita is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Anecita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear clothes to sell. Anecita has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Anecita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam, a single mother of four children, all of whom are in school, resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food. 

Working seven days a week, Zam has been operating a stall selling green bananas at the market for 15 years.  Her major challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Zam has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She would like to start growing  bananas and also educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells first and second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one and a half years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from poultry farming. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of first and second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to get a permanent business location. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new and used clothes.

loans.name: Milagros Noemi

texts.es:
Milagros es una joven de 20 años de edad, para poder llevar un sustento a su hogar trabaja como vendedora en una farmacia de su ciudad, Milagros cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y es responsable.

Milagros esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar, materiales para poder tarrajear, colocar piso y mejorar las paredes de una pequeña habitación que le ha dado su familia para que ella pueda vivir, así ella mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Milagros, 20, is a young woman who’s employed as a saleswoman in a pharmacy in her city to earn household income.  Milagros believes she does well at work because she’s very kind to customers and because she’s responsible.

Milagros is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they have provided her she will be able to buy building supplies to seal the walls, install a floor and improve the walls in the small bedroom her family has given her to live in.  She will improve her quality of life this way and continue striving to make her great dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Canton Plaza Los Cerezales Group

texts.es:
El Señor Norberto Felipe es casado. Tiene 48 años de edad. Curso 3 años de educación primaria. Tiene 2 hijos que no estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos. Inició este negocio vendiendo con su padre en la plaza de su municipio y a la fecha lleva 30 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de 4 cerditos y para concentrado de los mismos. En el futuro muy próximo desea tener una grnaja grande.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se decian a la venta de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Norberto Felipe, 48, is married.  He completed third grade.  He has two children who do not attend school.  He works raising domestic animals and started the business selling with his father in his town’s main square.  To date he has 30 years’ experience.

He organizes a group and requests a loan to buy four piglets and feed for them.  He’d like to have a large farm in the very near future.

The other group members sell domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Miguel Julian

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 62 años de edad, trabaja en su oficio como albañil, trabajo con el cual puede obtener los ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Miguel cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable con sus clientes.

Miguel está agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar maderas para su trabajo ya que les son necesaria para el llenado de columnas, así podrá hacer mejor su trabajo y hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener una empresa constructora”.
texts.en:
Miguel, 62, works in construction earning income to support his family.  Miguel believes he does well because he’s very responsible with his customers.

Miguel is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide because thanks to it he will be able to buy lumber for work since it’s necessary to frame columns and he’ll be able to do better work and make his dream reality: to own a construction firm.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is 26-years old, humble, and very hard-working. He is the first born in a family of four, with two young brothers and a sister, all of whom are still attending school. Mumbi is the only one in his family who has completed high school education at this point. 

Recently, Mumbi began operating his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Prior to starting, he worked as a teller and business manager in one of the busiest Zoona mobile money transfer shops in Lusaka. He enjoyed the job, and worked there for three years. Through time, Mumbi developed the interest of opening his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. He asked his boss for support, and decided to open his own shop in a garden compound.  

Mumbi has requested a Kiva loan so that he can purchase the trading booth he is currently using, and top-up on his working capital float. This will enable him to meet the demand of additional customers and make more profit. 

Mumbi is certain that once his business grows and becomes more profitable, he will be able to spend some of his profits on furthering his own education. One day, Mumbi would like to become a college graduate with a degree in business management.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth and top-up on his working capital float, so he can grow his business.

loans.name: Sagipa

texts.en:
Sagipa is a student of the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics, and below is her story.

“I have been thinking about my future education, my future college, since eighth grade. It is really important to make the right choice what profession one wants to gain. Therefore, I have enrolled in the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. 

"I am impressed by AUCA’s rich history and its current efforts connected to inclusiveness and equality. The collaboration between the faculty and undergraduate students, the sense of community, and flexible interdisciplinary nature of the curriculum is all important to me. 

"I have been interested in studying international relations or international politics for many years. My interest in pursuing this field stems from several factors which have affected me. The first factor is my studies in the US. I had a great chance to represent my country. That year gave me a lot of experience, feelings, and thoughts. 

"Second, I am fascinated by history, economics, and diplomacy. I believe, through the study of international politics, I can effectively satisfy my curiosity in these fields. 

"And the third factor that had affected my interest in international politics is that I would like to become a person to represent our country abroad. The last thing I can tell about my choice is that I believe that, after graduation of AUCA, I will become professional in the political field. 

"Participating in my high-school’s debate program has been my most meaningful activity in the US. This experience has changed me. I have learned how to speak in front of a huge number of students, without getting nervous and how to argue the merits of any side. 

"Taking part in the debates also gave me an opportunity to be aware of current topics of global importance, such as the debate problems of the homeless, healthcare, etc. I think participation in debates will help me in my future career. It is something that I feel enthusiastic about.

"The other point worth mentioning about AUCA is that it gives the students a very unique opportunity which is a loan for students to be able to cover their tuition fees. I will take an opportunity to apply for it also, which will give me a good opportunity to be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Gloria Elsa

texts.es:
Gloria de 39 años, tiene 6  hijos (cuatro hembras y dos varones), una tiene 18 años de edad,  Estudio 9ª grado,  la segunda de 17 años hace noveno  grado, la tercera tiene 15 años está cursando 7ª grado y el varón tiene 13 años de edad, está estudiando 5ª grado, el otro varón tiene 7 años está estudiando primer grado y la última niña tiene 5 años e ira al jardín de niños el próximo año.  
El esposo trabaja la agricultura, hace 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y 3,500 de frijol. 

Gloria se dedica a la elaboración de pan, tiene experiencia desde que tenía 12  años de vida y la adquirió con la mamá de ella, debido a que ella se dedicaba a este rubro, era una buena panificadora, le dejo este legado de hacer pan.
Tiene 27 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Con la elaboración del pan,  le empezó a aportar al esposo con los gastos de la casa. Ella solo ha tenido esa fuente de ingreso y crianza de aves de coral.
Con el crédito comprara 3 sacos de abono, pagara mano de obra, también pagara $ 100 dólares que presto para la primera abonada, el resto lo utilizara en la compra de materia prima para hacer el pan: azúcar, harina, canela royal.

Con el crédito mejorara la calidad de vida, porque tendrá mayores ingresos, a la vez tendrá lo necesario en la casa que es el maíz y el frijol. Sera satisfecha la necesidad de tener toda la materia prima alimentaria para la familia.         

A futuro le gustaría seguir  trabajado  muy fuerte, para alcanzar los objetivos propuestos, que  es darle estudio a los hijos para ella, eso sería la meta más deseada,  pide a Dios vida, para ver a los hijos crecer y prepararse   académicamente.
texts.en:
Gloria, 39, has six children, four girls and two boys.  One is 18 and completed 9th grade, the second one is 17 and is in 9th grade, the third is 15 and in 7th grade; her boy is 13 and in 5th grade, the other boy is 7 and in first grade and her youngest girl is five and will start kindergarten next year.  Her husband works in agriculture growing 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans.

Gloria’s a baker.  She’s been baking bread since the age of 12 having learned from her mother since she too was a baker.  She was a good baker and left this legacy to her.

She’s been in this business for 27 years.  Thanks to the bakery she was able to start helping her husband with household expenses.  Her only source of income has been the bakery and raising barnyard fowl.

She will use the loan to buy three sacks of manure, to pay labor costs, will use $100 dollars to repay a loan she used for the first manure application and will use the rest to buy bread-baking raw materials like sugar, flour, cinnamon and baking powder.

The loan will improve her quality of life because her income will rise and at the same time she’ll have everything like corn and beans needed at home.  The need to have all raw materials needed to feed her family will be met.

In future, she’d like to continue working hard to reach her set goals the main one being to provide education for her children.  She asks God for life to see her children grow and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure, pay labor costs, pay rent and to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 47-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been manufacturing iron accessories, such as spare parts of vehicles and household goods, by smelting iron under a high temperature burner. His practice is to buy scrap iron from the scrap market and put it into the high temperature burner for smelting and then fill it into the casts for reshaping. In this way, he manufactures the accessories on demand and makes enough income to contribute to the family's livelihood. 

Suriya's husband wants to grow his business and he wants to manufacture more iron accessories to sell, but he does not have money for further investment. Therefore, Suriya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy more raw materials for various iron accessories.  

Suriya has six children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide her children with good food, health, and education. She is in her seventh loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan and, until this time, she has been showing good payment history. 

She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her husband's business.

Suriya is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron for her husband's iron manufacturing business.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta el  6ª  grado.  El esposo trabaja vendiendo pan dulce, se traslada a la capital a traer el pan y viene vendiendo por los diferentes municipios de barrios del departamento del país. Ella tiene 4 hijas hembras, una tiene 14 años de edad que está cursando el  7ª grado, la segunda de 11 años hace tercer grado de estudio, la tercera tiene 5 años ya va a kínder y la ultima de 2 años.

Tiene experiencia desde que tenía 10 años de vida y la adquirió con la mamá de ella, en el rubro de venta de pan, queso y cuajada.

Con el crédito construirá un muro de contención a un costado de la casa, pagara mano de obra, a la vez comprara tubo galvanizado, maya ciclón, también otra camionada de piedra, cemento y arena.

Cabe mencionar que con este muro que esta haciendo mejorara la calidad de vida, porque tendrá mas seguridad, los niños no saldrán al peligro a la calle, y por la seguridad en la noche también, este crédito para la familia le ayudaría mucho. 

A futuro le gustaría seguir  trabajado  muy fuerte, para alcanzar los objetivos propuestos, que  es darle estudio a las hija de ella para que no tengan la vida que a ella, le ha tocado que es trabajar desde muy chica, ella le pide  al creador que le de vida para ver a las hijas preparada académicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, completed sixth grade.  Her husband works selling sweet bread.  He goes to the capital to get the bread and sells it in the various municipalities and neighborhoods in the country’s department.  She has four girls.  One is 14 and in 7th grade, the second is 11 and in third grade, the third is 5 and in kindergarten and the youngest is two.  She’s been gaining experience selling bread, cheese and curd since the age of 10 when she’d help her mother.

She will use the loan to build a retaining wall along the side of her house.  She will pay labor costs and buy galvanized a metal tube, cyclone wire and another truckload of stone, cement and sand.

It’s worth mentioning that this wall she’s building will improve her quality of life because she’ll have more security.  Her children won’t be exposed to danger in the street and will have security at night.  This loan will help the family much.

In future, she’d like to continue working very hard to reach her set goals the main one being to provide education for her daughters so their lives will be different than hers who has had to work since she was very little.  She asks the Creator to give her life to see her children become academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married, with five children and they all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates poultry farming on retail basis, from home. She has been in business for ten years. Caroline works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling green bananas at the market. 

Caroline has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy vaccines, poultry  feed,  chicks, and bunches of green bananas. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements, and transportation. She aspires to educate her children to the university level.  

Caroline resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of poultry feed, vaccines, and chicks.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
Dunia is a 46-year-old, married mother of six children. She has a convenience store in which she has sold candies, canned foods, and other food supplies for the last 30 years. Dunia supports her husband, who works as a bus driver, in covering their family’s needs.  She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into improving her business. She improves her business by adding new items and increasing her business capital with special offer products. These help her in increasing her income and replying to customers’ needs. 

Dunia is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special autumn and winter offers. She’ll be capable of providing offers to customers with especially attractive and encouraging prices. Dunia works on creating the need, with the special offers she acquires and displays to customers.

As for the future, Dunia hopes to expand her convenience store by increasing her business capital with several specialty items that are highly requested by customers.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special autumn and winter offers

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras El Ro Group

texts.es:
La señora Astrid Lucero de estado civil soltera. Tiene 22 años de edad. Curso la secundaria completa. Tiene una tienda de artículos de consumo diario y con las ganancias que obtiene sostiene sus estudios de la univesidad. Inició este negocio por un pequeño capital que le concediera su madre y a la fecha lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda. Desea en el futuro tener una abarroteria, para obtener mejores ganancias y asi poder pagar los gastos de la universidad.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedeican a comercio y venta de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
Astrid Lucero, 22, is single.  She completed secondary school and has a store selling basic daily consumption staple goods.  She uses the profits earned to pay her university costs.  She started the business with a small capital she got from her mother and to date has two years’ experienced.

She organizes a group and requests a loan she’ll use to buy merchandise to stock her store.  She wants in future to have a grocery store to earn higher profits and pay her university costs.

The other group members are merchants and sell cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Sagarmati Devi

texts.en:
Sagarmati  Devi is a 33-year-old, married woman with one son and three daughters. They live in a small village called Ahidapur Tole in Kalaiya market of the Bara district of Nepal. She has set up a small furniture-making shop where her husband makes different types of furniture products including tables, chairs, sofa sets, Almira furniture, beds, etc. 

She wants to expand her furniture business so that she can offer a wider range of products. So, she has requested the loan amount of 50,000 Nepalese Rupees (fifty thousand Nepalese Rupees only) to carry out this expansion. She has very good personal references within her community. She hopes for business expansion and prosperity for her family members.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of her furniture business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children; all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for five years. She works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from selling charcoal at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to educate her children to university level.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a solar home lighting system to replace the use of candles

loans.name: La Estancia  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Estancia está formado por 7 mujeres que viven en el cantón de Paute, este lugar goza de mucha belleza natural, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores al igual que una gran variedad de frutos, su clima es templado. Su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres amables y gentiles que luchan día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica para salir adelante, trabajan en tareas del campo como la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio, a pesar de las dificultades a diario que existen siempre se encuentran con una sonrisa.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carla, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y vecinas del grupo de crédito La Estancia y ha sido invitada por una amiga, ahora es la presidenta de este hermoso grupo, espera que todas unidas puedan realizar sus metas y sueños para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
La Señora Carla tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de un año y medio, vive con sus hermanos con quien comparte los gastos de la casa, la casa es propiedad de sus padres.
Doña Carla desde hace 8 meses tiene su propio negocio, ella vende comida para lo cual trabajan de martes a domingo desde muy temprano hasta más o menos las 5 de la tarde, en este negocio le tiene a una tía como socia.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres que le hacen falta para su negocio y así continuar creciendo. 
Su meta es terminar sus estudios colegiales.
texts.en:
The “La Estancia” communal bank consists of 7 women living in Paute Canton, a place with much natural beauty with fertile soil where the most beautiful flowers and a great variety of fruit are grown; its climate is mild.  Its residents like the members are kind, gracious women who strive daily to improve their economic stability to get ahead.  They work doing agricultural tasks, raising animals and in commerce.  Despite daily difficulties that exist, they are always smiling.

One of the members is Carla.  She’s taking out her first loan with her friends and neighbors in La Estancia group; she was invited by a friend and now she’s the president of this beautiful group.  She hopes that all of them together can reach their goals and dreams to provide better futures for their children.

Carla is 19-years-old and single mother of a one-and-a-half-year-old girl.  She lives with her siblings and shares household expenses with them.  The house is their parents’ property.

Carla has had her own business for the last 8 months.  She sells food Tuesday through Sunday starting very early and continues until about 5 in the afternoon.  Her aunt is her business partner. She will use the loan money to buy foodstuffs needed for her business to continue growing.  Her goal is to complete high-school.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo is 48 years old and lives with his wife, daughter, and son in the village of Velistsikhe.  Sergo is involved in the agricultural business and owns a vineyard. He works hard the whole year to get a good grape harvest. His grape is always high quality and easily sold among retailers. Sergo’s wife is a baker. She works at the local bakery in return for a small monthly salary. Sergo’s daughter earns money as well, working as a saleslady at the grocery store. Sergo’s son is a student and wishes to get a good job after graduation. 

The family earnings are too small and they live in poverty. They get social assistance from the local government as the family lives under the poverty line. The social assistance is approximately $90 per month.  

Sergo is requesting the loan to purchase a second-hand car and start a taxi business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Sergo applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of their Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 2,000 GEL will help Sergo to purchase a car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them in return for a service fee. Sergo is very enthusiastic and is a hard-working person with a great desire to get ahead. This credit will be a great support for the family. Sergo is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start up a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute candles, improve their family's lighting, and better distribute their family budget

loans.name: Sadbere

texts.en:
Sadbere is 30 years old and living in a Roma community, with her husband and four young children. She is a housewife, spending her time taking care of the household needs and their children, while her husband makes a living by carrying and transporting goods for others, for a small amount of money. Her husband's job is the family’s main source of income, but he does not earn enough to provide for all of the needs of his family. 

Currently, they live in a house which is in need of renovation. They live in a very small and old house which is in very poor condition. Sadbere is requesting a loan in order to do some renovations in the rooms where they live. This loan will help Sadbere and her family to improve their living conditions, keep utility costs down, and contribute to the general health and comfort of her family. 

Her goal is to renovate her house and she hopes to offer a better life to her family. Sadbere and her husband want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to do renovations in the rooms where they live.

loans.name: Ricardo Junior

texts.es: Ricardo Junior habita en Mangua, a pesar de su edad tiene metas bien definidas, logró terminar sus estudios y  ahora labora en un centro educativo como profesor de matemática y química, él aun no está casado y tampoco tiene hijos, considera que tiene que garantizar las condiciones de su vivienda para el futuro. Solicita el crédito para cambiar el techo de su casa, porque en invierno este no presta las condiciones, es necesario comprar materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y golosos.
texts.en:
Ricardo Junior lives in Managua.  In spite of his young age, he has well-defined goals.  He managed to complete his education.  He now works at an educational center as a mathematics and chemistry teacher.  He is not yet married, nor does he have children.  He believes that he needs to ensure his living conditions for the future.

He is requesting the loan in order to change the roof of his house because in the winter time it does not provide adequate conditions.

He needs to buy construction materials like zinc metal sheets, beams, and screws.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like zinc metal sheets, beams, and screws.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil is 47 years old. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. He is married and has two sons, ages 23 and 18. His older son is engaged and working at a food store. His younger son began working as a taxi-driver last year.

Habil is a farmer. He raises sheep. He has been in this business for ten years. He earns income from selling sheep meat.

Habil wants to repair his little farm. He needs 1,000 AZN to repair his farm for winter. This is the reason Habil has applied to Kiva. He thanks Kiva for helping him.

In the future, Habil wants marriage for his elder son and he dreams of growing his sheep business.

loans.use: to repair his farm for winter.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old. She is married and has four children. 

Lolita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been farming rice for thirty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation, and grows taro, banana and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for over 3 years. 

Evelina has requested a loan to buy weed killer, bush knives, fertilizer, wheel-barrow, spade and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Evelina hopes to improve her business to support her financially.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, bush knives, fertilizer, wheel-barrow, spade and rakes.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 29-year-old married man from Jenin city. He is a father for a small son. Fadi is a worker outside Jenin. His salary is not stable. Fadi works also in a small coffee shop he owns. He sells some grocery products and also sells light sandwiches and soft drinks. His shop is located in a very good area in the city.
 
Fadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some inventory for making traditional food for his shop. This will improve his productivity and also his income.
 
Fadi appears in the photo in his shop

loans.use: to buy some inventory for making traditional food for his shop.

loans.name: Rotila

texts.es: Rotila tiene 24 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de material noble. Su principal sustento económico depende de la producción de cacao orgánico que cultiva en unas parcelas que le heredaron sus padres hace 5 años por ser una madre muy luchadora a pesar de las adversidades que vivió antes de su separación. Para un producción fluida debe contar siempre con capital y destinarlo en la contrata de trabajadores para agilizar las labores tales como el deshierbo de maleza y posterior cosecha. El cacao orgánico es un producto cuya rentabilidad en su zona varía de acuerdo a la calidad obtenida por ello es indispensable ser constantes en el mantenimiento correspondiente. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar y comprar herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en: Rotilia is 24 years old and the single mother of three children who live with her in a solidly built home.  Her main source of income is from raising organic cacao on some land that her parents gave her five years ago because she is a hardworking mother, despite the adversities she had before her separation.  She needs to have capital so she can pay workers to speed up the work tasks, such as weeding, and harvest, in order to maintain steady production.  Organic cacao is a profitable product in her area, and it depends on the quality, so it’s important to be consistent with the maintenance.  This will be her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she’s getting so she can move ahead.  She is committed to making her payments on time.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN to hire local workers and buy work tools.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy tools.

loans.name: Delsy Arely

texts.es:
La señora Delsy es una persona trabajadora y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y su hijo. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tamales desde hace 3 años.
Doña Delsy sale a vender de manera ambulante en su comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como maíz, hojas para tamal, frijoles, gallinas, leña, pan, refrescos,  condimentos, verduras,  etc.  Son los productos que necesita para la elaboración de sus tamales.
Doña Delsy espera que el préstamo le sirva mucho y así seguir elaborando su producto, además  espera un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que ayuden a mejorar su estilo vida y la de su familia. Ella espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y así seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Delsy's a hardworking and honest person.  She lives with her husband and her son in a community in the south of Honduras.

Delsy's business for the past three years has been making and selling tamales.  She goes out on foot to make sales in her community.

Delsy's requesting the loan to buy more ingredients to make her tamales: corn, leaves to wrap tamales, beans, chickens, firewood, bread, soda, condiments, vegetables, and so on.  

She hopes the loan will be a big help to her so she can keep on making her product.  She also hopes for a increase in sales and more income to help improve her lifestyle and her family's.  She wants her business to keep growing.  That way she can keep helping her children in their studies and they'll have greater opportunities in the future.

Choluteca, Honduras, September 2013

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tamales

loans.name: Rosauro

texts.en:
This is Rosauro; 49 and resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Ma. Theresa, a tutor, and he is a father of two children; the eldest is in high school while the youngest is in elementary. By the grace of God, Rosauro has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually send his children to school to finish their degrees.

Rosauro oversees operations of their jeepney* (see footnote) transportation business. They have a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new tires for the jeepneys, and renew his registration. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rosauro dreams that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his work every week.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney. It is open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 37-year-old married man from a small village called Attel, near Tulkarem city. He lives with his wife and four kids; three sons and one daughter. All of his children are attending school. Eyad has a small farm where he raises sheep and sells their meat to the local traders. It is a good business but it's income is seasonal.
 
Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him have an urgent surgery. He does not have that money now, so he took this loan. 
Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent surgery for him.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
