She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, cooking oil, and rice. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She aspires to educate her children to the university level.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, and beans

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 82 years old and widowed, with nine children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in the Likoni area, which is south of Mombasa. 

She has been running a water business for more than two years. She sells water to the locals for an income. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and she joined so that she could access credit to fund her business. She now seeks a loan to build a water storage tank. 

She hopes that in the next five years she will be able to open more branches of her business, despite the challenge of water rationing. 

She will use the extra income to improve her business and improve her standards of living, too.

loans.use: to build a water storage tank

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
Onua Do group is located on the outskirts of Teshie Township. The group members are basically involved in small scale retail sales of such products as yams, milk, wax prints, maize, plastic plates and bags. They have an average age of 30 years and average three children each.

Bernard is a 35-year-old married man and a father of three. His main business is to supply yams to foodstuff sellers in Accra. He buys the items from the northern part of the country where he comes from and supplies customers in Accra where he lives. He has all three children going to school. Bernard is sometimes supported by his wife, who has also been trading in vegetables since 2005. His main clients are foodstuff traders in Accra.

Bernard is determined to use his loan request amount of GHS 1,000 from Kiva partner ID-Ghana to change his life and benefit his family by investing it in his yam business. He is on his forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and has repaid all previous loan without trouble.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 10,100 so that they can increase stock and serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy and supply yams to foodstuff sellers in Accra.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 26 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in the Kongowea area, which is north of Mombasa, Kenya. 

She has a cosmetics sales business that has been in operation for the last two years. The business has grown since it started, and she has been able to employ someone to help her run the business. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy cosmetic items like lotions and ornaments. She hopes that in future, she will be able to open a money transfer service (M-pesa) and serve more customers. 

The major challenge that she has to deal with is lack of capital. She will use the income raised to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products like lotions and ornaments.

loans.name: María Amanda

texts.es:
María de 69 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, ya mayores de edad y que posee sus propios hogares uno de ellos vive en la comunidad, dos viven en la capital y uno esta en los estados unidos de América.

Ella estudio hasta segundo grado, se acompaño a los 19 años de edad con su esposo y se casaron en el año 2000.
vivieron 20 años en la capital del país donde ella cuidaba de sus hijos mientras su esposo trabajo, todos esos años en una empresa de energía eléctrica; luego él se jubilo y se regresaron a la comunidad de donde son originarios, y se dedicaron a los trabajos de la agricultura y ganaderia.

Su esposo murió en el año 2002 de causas naturales, y hoy en día solo vive con 3 nietos a quienes cuida y son ellos quienes le ayudan en los trabajos de la agricultura, en los tiempos libre pues uno de ellos trabaja, otro estudia en la comunidad y el otro es enfermito y tiene que estar pendiente de él.
De su esposo recibe una pensión mensualmente y sus hijos siempre están pendiente de ella.


Por su parte,  desde pequeña se creció en los quehaceres del hogar, y sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles, maicillo y los trabajos del cultivo de mezcal), ademas cuidaba del ganado en el hogar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arena, cemento, piedras y el pago de la mano de obra, pues necesita empedrar y fraguar una calle del terreno, donde ella vive la cual conecta con la carretera principal, ademas de hacer otras mejoras en la vivienda, estima que invertirá para ello $1000.00 y el resto lo necesita pues tiene pendiente unos gastos personales.

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, mientras tenga fuerzas en la agricultura y seguir motivando a sus nietos para estudiar y que salgan adelante-
texts.en:
María, 69, is mother of four adult children who have homes of their own.   One of them lives in the community, two live in the capital and one is in the United States of America.  She completed second grade and at the age of 19 got together with her husband; they were married in the year 2000.

For 20 years they lived in the nation’s capital where she raised her children while her husband worked all those years for an electric energy company.  Later, he retired and they returned to the community they came from originally and started working in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Her husband died in the year 2002 of natural causes and today she lives with three grandchildren she cares for and who help her with the agricultural chores in their free time for one of them is employed, the other attends school in the community and the other one is ill and she has to care for him.  She gets her husband’s monthly pension and her children are always watching over her.

On her part, since her childhood she grew up doing housework and her parents taught her how to work in the fields (to plant corn, beans, sorghum and agave).  She also took care of the cattle at home.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy sand, cement and stone and to pay labor costs because she needs to flatten and pave a street on her property that connects to the main highway as well as to do some other home improvements.  She figures she’ll spend $1,000 on this and will use the rest for some pending personal expenses she has.

Her dream is to continue working in agriculture as long as she has strength to do so and to continue motivating her grandchildren to study and to move forward.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo2, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  

In 2001, Mbalu established her palm oil business. She began her business to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mbalu requires a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living, and increase her business. 

In the future, Mbalu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Adama from Waterloo2, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child, age 7. She started this business to sustain her life.

Adama runs a medical drug business with the community; she has been running this business since 2011. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Adama says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient financing to expand her business.

Adama has requested a loan to buy more medical drugs to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more medical drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey lives in the Changamwe area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 34 years of  age, and he is married, with three children. Two of the children attend school; one is young and not yet in school.

Geofrey runs a spare-parts sales business in Changamwe, a business he started more than five years ago. The business has been growing over the years. He knew Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy an additional stock of motor-vehicle spare parts to sell in the business. The challenge that he faces in the business is the competition from other traders. 

He will use the extra income that he will raise to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of motor-vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is single, with two children. She has no additional family members. 

She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for one year. She works six days a week.  She gets additional income from selling fried cassava chips, at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

She aspires to educate her children to the university level.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old. She is married and has four children.  Two are married, and two are still studying. She lives in Delapa Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte.

Anita owns a parcel of rice field, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,000.  She has requested a new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for maintenance so she can harvest abundantly. 

Anita has been a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC for three years.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with one child. 

In 2011, Kadiatu established her general stock business.  She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m., Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and open a savings account. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
Jharana is the leader of a group that hails from Bissam Cuttack of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 35 years of age. She has a small family comprised of four members including one daughter and one son, aged 12 and 16 years respectively. The member standing second from right with raised hand is Jharana. 

Jharana manages a small grocery shop in her locality. Her husband does seasonal business in her village moving from market to market. In 2010 Jharana, along with other three members from her locality, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for develop their existing businesses. This is the third loan for Jharana from Mahashakti Foundation.  

At the time of accessing her first loan, her husband was accustomed to attend weekly markets of nearby villages for seasonal business. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a low profile way. To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, Jharana accessed a second loan and constructed a shed in her house and started selling grocery items. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her grocery shop significantly. At present her monthly income is Rs.5,000 but that is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a further loan to add some extra items like rice, pulses (lentils), sugar, tea, flour, oil and other grocery items.  She has a cherished dream to educate her children in a better school/college so they can get employment in the government sector.

The other three members are Susila, who has a fast food centre, and Sujata and Labanyabati who make and sell leaf plates.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pulses (lentils), sugar, tea, flour, oil and other grocery items

loans.name: Om Shanti Group

texts.en:
Runukar, aged about 35 years, is the group leader for a four-member group from Bissam Cuttack, a town situated in Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of three members, her husband and their 12-year-old son. The member standing on the extreme left with raised hand is Runukar. At present she is running a tailoring shop in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Runukar is a tailor. During 2010, she, along with three other members from her village formed a group and for the first time they took out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses. Runukar’s husband does seasonal business. At present her family income is Rs.4,500  per month which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will purchase a Pico Machine. She has a dream to educate her only son in a better school for better education and have a shop of her own.

The other three members named Ranjita, Sumitra and Subashini have a grocery shop, tailoring and Leaf plate businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico Machine

loans.name: Soumaya

texts.en:
Soumaya is a 45-year-old married mother of two children who has had a shoe selling shop for thirteen years. Soumaya supports her family financially, since her husband’s income is very low and isn’t enough to cover their family’s increasing needs.

Soumaya is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a special new autumn and winter collection to address her customers' needs and increase her income.

This is Soumaya’s first loan as an Al Majmoua borrower, and in the future she also expects to have loans; she is willing to expand her business through diversifying her products.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special autumn and winter collection

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu is married with three children and two go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon from home. She has been in business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

Sanyu has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy hair treatments, weaves, relaxers, braids and hair extensions. Her major business challenges include undependable electricity which hinders her business operations. She is aspiring of getting permanent business premises.  She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy hair treatments, relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 49 years old and married.  She has nine children, three of them are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dionisia has an oyster culture business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to  buy raw materials like binder, fishing nets, and bamboo.

Dionisia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like binder, fishing nets, and bamboo.

loans.name: Iha

texts.en: Iha lives in Likoni, south of Mombasa Kenya. He is 25 years old and he is married. He has been in the hawking business for more than five years and this business has been feeding his family. The business has grown and he has employed two people to help him run the business. He deals mostly with hardware items and electronic goods. He learned about Milango through friends and he joined so that he could be able to access credit to fund the business. He now seeks a loan to buy electronic goods and hardware items for his business. He will use the extra income that he will earn to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy electronic goods and hardware items

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 12 years and 18 years old.  In 2012, Fatmata established her charcoal business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future; Fatmata plans to change her business to a clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Sai Krupa Group

texts.en:
Basanti, a widow of 46 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Bissum Cuttack of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She has one son and one daughter aged 25 and 18, respectively. The member standing at the extreme right with her hand raised is Basanti. 

Basanti is managing a small grocery shop in her locality. During 2011, Basanti, along with three other members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. This is the second cycle loan.  

At the time of availing the first loan, her sales were not sufficient to meet her daily needs. Out of their small income they are maintaining their family in a low profile. Now, she is very confident in running her business and has developed her grocery shop significantly. At present, her monthly income is about 9,000 INR. She wants to take a further loan to purchase rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger and other grocery items. She wishes for her daughter to get married into a respectable family.

Of the other three members, Pramila and Pallibala are doing brick businesses and Krushnabasini is dealing with a rice business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger and other grocery items

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children. In 2002, Rugiatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to strive for her living. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina de 53 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, se caso a los 18 años de edad, con quien ha convivido hasta este día, juntos han trabajado muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos, cuatro de ellos ya se casaron y tienen sus propias familias. En la casa de habitación solo vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan a ella en el hogar.

Sus hijos todos son bachilleres y no ha seguido apoyándolos en los estudios universitarios, por falta de dinero.
Bernardina, no estudio pues sus padres no quisieron, enviarla a estudiar ni a sus otros cinco hermanos que ella tiene.


Ella se dedica desde los 20 años de edad, a la elaboración de hamacas, pues ella asistió a un taller en el municipio en donde aprendió y con el paso de los años ella ha ido perfeccionando el arte. Antes hacia hamacas de cascarilla, ahora hace hamacas de seda y de poliseda, elabora  un promedio de 5 a 6 hamacas en el mes y las comercializa en la ciudad, donde también compra el material, esto le toma 30 minutos caminando hasta donde tiene que ir a tomar el bus y luego hace 30 minutos en el bus para llegar a la ciudad.

 Compra cada 15 o 22 días el material para elaborar las hamacas. Se dedica hacer las hamacas después de los quehaceres del hogar, por las tardes, sus hijos también le ayudan cuando vienen de trabajar la agricultura.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para comprar una caja de hilo de seda, el cual esta valorada en $450 y el resto para otros gastos del hogar. Con ello,  podrá elaborar mas hamacas y tendrá mas ofertas para los clientes, pues en la temporada de noviembre y diciembre hay mas demanda por la época navideña.


El sueño, es seguir trabajando cada día mas, para elaborar mas hamacas y poder vender mas.
Ademas sueña mejorar su vivienda, ya que las paredes y el piso es de tierra, esto lo lograra poco a poco mediante las ganancias que espera percibir de las ventas de las hamacas, esta ahorrando para ello.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 53 years old and the mother of six grown children.  She married when she was 18 and is still together with her husband to this day.  Together they have worked very hard so their kids could get ahead.  Four of them are married and have their own families. She now lives with her husband and only two of their children who work and help around the house.

Her children have all graduated from high school and she has not continued supporting them with university studies because she doesn't have the money. Bernarda did not go to school because her parents didn't want to send her or her five other siblings. She has been working at making hammocks since the age of 20.  She went to a workshop in her town where she learned, and over time she has perfected the art. She used to make the hammocks from husks, but now she uses silk and poly silk.  She makes 5 or 6 hammocks per month and sells them in the city where she also buys the materials.  It takes her 30 minutes to walk to where she catches the bus, and the ride into the city takes another 30 minutes. 

She buys the materials to make the hammocks every 15 or 20 days and she makes them in the afternoon after finishing her household chores. Her children help her after they return from working in agriculture.

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy a box of silk yarn which costs $450 and she will use the rest for household expenses. With the loan, she will be able to make more hammocks and provide a better selection for her customers. In November and December demand increases because of the Christmas holidays. 

Her dream is to continue working more each day so she can make and sell more hammocks. She also dreams of improving her house since the walls and floor are made of dirt.  She will achieve this bit by bit with the earnings she hopes to make from the sale of her hammocks, and she is saving up for this.

loans.use: to buy a box of silk yarn which is valued at $450, and she will use the rest  for other household expenses.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor used the previous loan to buy salon equipment. His business improved. He also does farming and he is seeking another loan to put into his farm. 

He seeks a loan to buy seeds for his farm and fence his farm. His major purpose for now is to venture into greenhouse farming and be able to supply the whole town with horticultural goods. The major challenges for this venture are capital and pests. He hopes that the business will be stable in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fence his farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. El cliente  vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Él posee una venta de frutas y verduras, su venta la tiene instalada en la cama de un pick up el cual esta ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, desde hace 2 años, su compañera de vida  le ayuda con el negocio. El cliente  solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, papas, chiles verdes, tomates, etc. ya que de esta manera él  podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, así obtener mejores ganancias y  darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The client is a very hardworking man who is fully invested in his business.  His sole desire is to get ahead and offer his family a better life.  He lives with his wife and their son in their own house.  He has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for 2 years.  He operates it from the back of a pickup truck that is located in the town market near his house.  His wife helps him with his business.

The client is asking for a loan so he can buy papaya, bananas, pineapple, potatoes, green chiles, tomatoes, and other things.  In this way, he will be able to sell more (which is his main priority) and obtain greater profits.  By so doing, he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: buy papaya, bananas, pineapple, potatoes, green chiles, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 38 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vivian has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, aged 2 and the youngest three months old. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya, where he also does his business. 

He is a fruit vendor, and he has been in this business for the past four years. He knew Milango through friends and decided to join so that he could save and be able to access credit and fund his business. 

He now seeks a loan to buy bananas, oranges, mangoes, and watermelon for his business. The challenge in the business is price changes. 

He hopes that in the next five years he will be running a wholesale business.  He plans to use the extra income he will raise to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, mangoes, and watermelon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Desde hace muchos años Angela se dedica a la producción del café junto con su familia. Sus hijos son los que se encargan de la mayor parte del trabajo en el campo y ella se encarga de administrar las ganancias del negocio. Para esta cosecha que ya se acerca necesita un crédito para mandar a reparar una chapeadora, la cual utilizan para limpiar las parcelas.
texts.en: Angela has been farming coffee for many years together with her family.  Her children are who take care of most of the work in the fields and she manages the finances.  For this harvest (which is coming up soon), she needs a loan to get a weed eater repaired.  They use it to maintain their plots of land.

loans.use: repair her weed eater.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He has worked in the construction field for the past seven years. He got involved in this business at an early age in order to help his parents pay the operating costs. He works as a painter, and he is well talented at his job. 

Today, and in order to improve his business, Ali seeks to purchase an electrical generator. To do so, he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. 

He states that this generator will unquestionably let him continue his operations properly and will help him generate good profits. This is his first Kiva loan, and he hopes to be able to satisfy his clients' demands and get superior financial benefits.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children, and two are in school. She takes care of an additional family member (her mother). 

She sells charcoal on a retail basis.  She has been in business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality, the rainy season, which hinders her movements and transportation. 

She aspires to build rental houses.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster-culture business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials for her oyster-culture business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  es madre soltera vive con su hijo en casa propia, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y honesta desde hace  2  años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto en su lugar  residencia. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, la clienta ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  asi poder seguirle dando a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: The client is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son. She is a hard-working, responsible and honest woman who for the past two years has been raising cattle at her place of residence. She has good clients as she knows how to win their confidence. The client has decided to invest in caring for her cattle, as this is what her business depends on.  She has requested a loan so she can buy vitamins and concentrated feed. She wants to be able to unconditionally give her son a better quality of living,

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for livestock.

loans.name: Afrodicio Salvador

texts.es: Afrodicio  de 58 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su madre, él se dedica a la venta de medicina natural,  vende por  todas las colonias y cantones en su vehículo, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los  buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Afrodicio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina natral por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su madre.
texts.en:
Afrodicio is 58 years old and lives in a family member's house along with his mother.  He works selling natural medicine.  He uses his vehicle to sell throughout the region.  He has many customers due to the quality of his products and his good prices.  With the profits that he makes, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Afrodicio is asking for a loan to buy natural medicine wholesale so he can continue with his business, since it is his only source of income.  In this way, he and his mother will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy wholesale natural medicine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for six years, and she also earns additional income from a repair shop and general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Gabriel

texts.es: José Gabriel se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo desde pequeño, pues en la comunidad en donde vive no hay muchas oportunidades de empleo. Su principal actividad es la producción de café. Para la siguiente cosecha necesita un crédito para resembrar parte de su finca ya que algunas de las plantas con las que cuenta ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida útil y ya no producen buen café. Además de producir café también se dedica a la producción de limón, lo cual le sirve como un ingreso extra para él y su familia.
texts.en: José Gabriel has worked in the fields since he was little. In his community there are few employment opportunities. His main activity is growing coffee. For the coming harvest he needs a loan to replant part of his plantation. Some of the plants have exhausted their useful life cycle and no longer produce good coffee. Besides producing coffee he also grows lemons which serve as an extra source of revenue for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de agua de cocos, su negocio o tiene ubicado en las afueras de su municipio desde hace 10 años, posee mucha clientela por ser un lugar muy transitado por personas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  José esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor para poder tener los necesarios cuando le lleguen a comprar y así aumentar sus ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He sells coconut water.  He has had his business, which is located on the outskirts of the municipality, for ten years. He has a lot of clients as it is a busy area. With what he gets from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. 

Jose is requesting a loan to buy coconuts wholesale in order to have enough when people come to buy. He wants to increase his profits and offer his family a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Laura Estela

texts.es:
La señora Laura es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada, desde hace 8 años.
Doña Laura tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son amigos y vecinos del municipio donde vive y diversos lugares aledaños. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, pantalones, etc. y tener la mercadería necesaria para realizar sus ventas.
Doña Laura con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y a su vez espera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y  la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Laura espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y a sus hijos.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Laura is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives together with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. She has been selling used clothing for the last eight years. Laura conducts her business from her house. Her clients are her friends and neighbors of the municipality in which she lives and in several neighboring villages. 

Laura needs a loan to buy skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, etc. so that she has the merchandise she needs to make her sales. Laura hopes that with the loan her sales will increase. This loan will be very helpful as she doesn't have all the products necessary to fulfill her customers' requests. At the same time she wants to improve her family's quality of living with an increase in the revenues coming into her house. Laura hopes in the short term to expand her business and through this continue to support her family and her children.
Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, shirts etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who attend school. 

He has owned a store since 2007, where he sells mirrors and glass products. He has worked in this type of business for the past 22 years. 

Today, and in order to increase his store’s inventory, Ibrahim wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. 

He notes that the loan will surely assist in increasing his business sales and consequently his profits. 

Ibrahim is very ambitious and intends to work harder, so as to enhance the family’s way of living and help them meet their requirements.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is 37 years old; he lives with his wife and his four children in Nablus.

He has a poultry farm, and he earns a monthly income of US$ 1,300.  He started his business in 2010.

He needs this youth loan to repair the poultry yard and expand it. 

His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life.  Amjad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair the poultry yard and expand it.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who are attending school. 

She has been working at producing hand-made products since 2008. She is very talented and creates unique designs. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees. (She intends not to argue with the school management regarding the financials and to maintain a good relation with the whole team so as to guarantee an excellent educational path for her children in an agreeable environment.)

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is grateful that he received a Kiva loan that he was able to repay without challenge. His mechanic's business improved after the loan, and now he plans to get a loan for his retail shop. 

The retail shop started four years ago, and it has been growing over time. He has employed someone to manage the business on his behalf as he runs his workshop business. 

He is seeking a loan to buy polythene bags and retail commodities for the shop. The challenge that he faces in the business is competition. He will use the extra income to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags and retail commodities

loans.name: Jezail

texts.en:
Jezail is 19 years old and single, from Bethlehem city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her father is a worker with a low wage. 

Jezail finished her high school study this summer. She would like to go to the unversity and study tourism and hospitality, but her father does not have enough money to pay the university expenses.

Jezail has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to improve herself and find a better job in the future. 

Jezail appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: T o buy more fish

loans.name: Alphunsina

texts.en:
Alphunsina is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for eight years and works seven days a week.  

Alphunsina has applied for a loan of  600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy bale of second hand shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspires to get a permanent business premise.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Adama from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with eight children. In 2003, Adama established her soap business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil and soap to increase her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, Adama plans to change her business to a food stand business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and soap to increase her business.

loans.name: Pedro Enmanuel

texts.es:
Pedro Emmanuel es un joven que desea estudiar Mercadotecnia, él solicita un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Pedro Emmanuel, tengo 20 años de edad. Vivo en santo domingo este Rep. dom., soltero, tengo una hermana y mis padres son divorciados. Vivo con mi madre la cual es no vidente desde los 7 años de edad  pero esto no ha sido impedimento para poder sacar a su familia adelante, actualmente esta jubilada  pese que en nuestro país los trabajos para las personas con esas condiciones son escasos.
Tengo mucho anhelo de estudiar mercadotecnia, carrera en la cual me identifico desde que estaba cursando mi bachillerato, Quisiera ingresar a la universidad APEC. A pesar de haber finalizado mis estudias hace dos años se me ha hecho difícil iniciar los estudios universitarios, es por esto que acudo a esta ayuda.
Necesito esta ayuda porque es la vía para poder alcanzar y hacer realidad mis sueños. Con el logro de mis metas de ser un gran profesional en el área de mercadeo podre darle una mejor calidad de vida a mi familia.
Dentro de mis sueños esta ocupar un puesto en el área de mercadeo antes de terminar mi carrera en una prestigiosa empresa, así al momento de finalizar mis estudios universitarios mis conocimientos académicos se complementaran con los conocimientos laborales adquiridos y así poder ocupar el mejor cargo en el área.
texts.en:
Pedro Emmanuel is a young man who wants to study marketing. He is applying for a loan to be able to pay for his studies. This is his story:

My name is Pedro Emmanuel. I am 20 years old. I live in East Santo Domingo, in the Dominican Republic. I am single. I have a sister, and my parents are divorced. I live with my mother, who hasn't been able to see since she was 7 years old, but this has not been an impediment in being able to raise her family. Now she is retired, even though in our country jobs are scarce for people with these conditions.

I have a great desire to study marketing, a career with which I identified since I was in secondary school. I would like to enter the APEC University. In spite of having completed my [secondary] studies two years ago, it has been difficult for me to begin university studies. It is for this reason that i have turned to this [source of] help.

I need this help because it is the way to be able to reach and make a reality of my dreams. With the achievement of my goals of being a great professional in the area of marketing, I will be able to give a better quality of life to my family.

Part of my dreams is to have a position in the area of marketing with a prestigious business before finishing my course of study. Thus at the time I finish my university studies, my academic knowledge will be complemented with acquired working knowledge and I will thus be able to occupy the best positions in the area.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in marketing

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José de 32 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipián desde hace varios años, de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable,  no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. asi como muestra la fotografía. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 32 and has been growing corn and squash for several years. This is how he earns a living and is able to support his household. He is a very hard-working, honest and responsible man who never tires of working and proving the best for his family. He lives in his own home with his wife and son. 

He has made the decision to request a loan in order to buy the main agricultural supplies: manures, pest spray, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc., as shown in the photo. He hopes to have favorable results, as he has no other source of income. He trusts in God that he will succeed in obtaining an abundant harvest which will allow him to continue supporting his household.

loans.use: To buy manures, pest spray, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Marie from Waterloo 2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children. Her children are currently attending school. twenty years ago, Marie established her cake business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of enough capital to expand her business and price inflation.

Marie requires a loan in order to buy flour, cooking oil, and sugar to expand her cake business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future; Marie plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, and sugar to expand her cake business

loans.name: Adilia Del Rosario

texts.es: Adilia es una mujer emprendedora, originaria de la ciudad de Jinotega. De 33 años de edad y madre soltera de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella inicio su negocio hace cinco años, motivada por personas de la  comunidad quienes necesitaban un puesto de frutas y verduras debido a que no contaban con uno, fue así que Adilia estableció su negocio en su casa. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que satisfacera las necesidades de sus clientes, obtendrá mayores ventas e ingresos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: piña, banano, manzanas, uvas, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio. Su plan próximo es invertir mucho más y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Adilia is an entrepreneurial woman, originally from the city of Jinotega. She is 33 years old and the single mother of two children. She is a businesswoman. She sells fruits and vegetables. She began her business five years ago, motivated by people in the community who needed a fruit and vegetable stand because they didn't have one. It was thus that Adilia established her business in her house. She estimates that the loan will be of great help, since she will satisfy the needs of her customers, and she will obtain better sales and income. She is applying for the loan to buy pineapples, bananas, apples, grapes, tomatoes, peppers, and onions, among other items, with the goal of stocking her business. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her business. Her next plan is to invest much more and grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, bananas, apples, grapes, tomatoes, peppers, and onions, among other items.

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es: Rosa Ivania, habita en Managua y desde hace muchos años ayuda fuertemente a su esposo que tiene su trabajo de conductor. Ella ha tenido la visión de tener más que una fuente de ingreso para su familia, porque de esta manera ha podido educar a sus dos hijos, a pesar que la tarea aun no termina con su hijo de 17 años de edad que estudia. Doña Rosa solicita el crédito para la compra de una variedad de productos cosméticos de la marca AVON y joyas de plata que comercializa en casa, sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con la calidad y variedad de sus productos, especialmente con las facilidades de pago que Rosa ofrece.
texts.en:
Rosa Ivania lives in Managua and for many years has been greatly helping her husband, who has his job as a driver. She has had the vision of having more than one source of income for their family, because in this way she has been able to educate their two children, despite the spite the fact that the task is still not completed with his 17-year-old son who goes to school. 

Rosa is requesting the loan to buy a variety of Avon brand cosmetic products and silver jewelry that she sells at home. Her customers are satisfied with the quality and variety of her product, especially with the payment terms that Rosa offers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of Avon brand cosmetic products and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Maria Romilia

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y yuca con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a house of her own with her husband and five children. She has been working as a farmer for many years now, which is her main source of income. She cultivates corn and cassava and with her earnings she is able to settle some of her household expenses.

Maria wishes to purchase the necessary supplies for her crops such as compost, fertilizer, seeds, pest control, herbicide, etc. Since she does not have the necessary economical resources for this investment, she has decided to apply for a loan as its the only way she can continue her farming process.

Just like any other farmer, she trusts in agriculture since she doesn't have any other source of income. She hopes to obtain an abundant harvest which will allow her to continue providing her household with their daily bread and to settle this loan.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, seeds, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Estela

texts.es: Maritza de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad,  ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como: pastelitos de carnes, yuca,  empanas,  atoles, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la higiene con que los realiza, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para gastos personales necesita comprar  algunos artículos de primera necesidad que hacen falta en su casa y que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprarlos y así pueda vivir mejor con su familia sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children, who are 12 and 8 years old. She works selling snacks such as pastelitos de carne [meat-filled pastries], cassava, pasties, and atoles [corn-based hot drinks]. Her business is based in her home, and she has many customers thanks to her good prices and level of hygiene.

She is seeking a loan for personal expenses, as she needs to buy essential items that are lacking in her home, and what she earns is not enough to afford them. This way she will be able to live better with her family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy essential items for her home.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia de 50 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tamales y atol de elote desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la higiene con que prepara los alimentos y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 20 y 22 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, doña Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de elotes por mayor para poder seguir produciendo mas alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 50, has been selling tamales (steam-cooked corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) and atol de elote (a sweet corn and milk drink) for several years.  She works from home and has a lot of customers who appreciate the hygienic way in which she prepares the food and the friendly service she offers.  With her earnings, she manages to pay some of the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children, who are 20 and 22 and both studying at the moment.
  
Sonia is asking for a loan to buy corn in bulk so she can continue preparing the food, which will allow her to make more money and provide her family with more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es: Tomás ha sido agricultor durante toda su vida, primero comenzó al lado de su padre quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para poder trabajar en el campo y cuando se casó le heredó unas tierras para que trabajara. Ahora Tomás se dedica a la producción de café junto con sus hijos y es esta su principal actividad económica. Para la siguiente cosecha necesita un crédito que utilizará para la compra una fumigadora para la aplicación de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Tomás has been a farmer his whole life. He started out beside his father who taught him all that was necessary in order to be able to work in the field. When he married, he inherited from his father some property so that he could work. 

Today, Tomás works in the production of coffee along with his children and this is his main source of income. For the next harvest he needs a loan which he will use to purchase a spraying machine for the application of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase a spraying machine

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La  señora  María  es una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable   y seria, vive  con su familia  en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  ropa y tiene su negocio desde hace más de 10 años.
Doña María su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son vecinos de lugares cercanos a su comunidad  esta actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos. El préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, short, blusas, faldas, etc.
Doña María con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco su situación  económica y la de su familia.  
Doña  María  espera que  a un corto plazo su negocio siga  creciendo y  convirtiéndose   en  el  más conocido de su barrio y seguir  apoyando a su hijos para que se conviertan en personas honesta  con principios y valores.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Septiembre  del   2013
texts.en:
Maria is an entrepreneur who is honest, responsible and takes her work seriously.  She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras.  Her business is the buying and selling of clothes and she has had this business for more than 10 years.

Maria’s business is located in her house and her customers are neighbors from areas close to her community.  This business provides her with the largest share of her income.  She needs the loan to buy clothes such as trousers, shirts, shorts, blouses, skirts etc.

With this loan, Maria hopes that her sales will increase by having more merchandise to offer, which will cover the needs of her customers.  This will help her improve a little her economic situation and that of her family.

Maria hopes that in the short term her business will continue to grow and will become the most well-known in the neighborhood and she will be able to continue to support her children and bring them up as honest people with strong principles and values.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, shorts, blouses, skirts, etc for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta es madre soltera vive en la casa de una tía con su hija la cual asiste a una escuela cercana de la localidad. Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; la clienta es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para ella el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes,  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su hija seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
The borrower is a single mother. She lives in her aunt's house with her daughter, who attends a nearby school. She has a small store selling clothing of different styles and for all types of people, including men, women, boys and girls. She sells good-quality clothing at affordable prices, and so has recently built up a large customer base.

She is very active and is always to be found working and striving to get on. She brings purpose and courage to her work, with the aim of seeing her business grow and achieving a better future. This is why she decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral, which will allow her to buy a range of clothing, such as skirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, suits, etc. This will mean that she will always be able to meet her customers' needs, and she hopes that she will thus be able to give her daughter financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to buy a range of clothing, such as skirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, suits, etc.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 30 years old and he lives in the village of Goght in Kotayk region. He lives with his retired mother and together, they perfectly manage their farm. Unfortunately, several years ago Armen’s father died and now he is responsible for his mother’s care.  On his farm, Armen has two cows, two heifers, two bulls and two calves. He also cultivates fruit and vegetables on the land. From the garden he manages to sell nuts, pear and grapes among other things.  They use the vegetables mainly for their own consumption. They also sell meat and different dairy-products to the local food markets. Besides all these jobs, Armen is also engaged in cultivation of Holland roses in a greenhouse. The flowers bring not only financial profit to his family but also beauty and nice aroma that is spread around their house making people envy Armen's job.
So Armen is asking for a loan of 900.000 Armenian drams in order to pay for feed for his farm cattle and he also plans to get married and needs some money for that.

loans.use: To pay for various farming needs like feed for his cattle, and also assist him with wedding costs for his future wedding

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is from the Chaitura district, West Georgia. She is 37 years old and married with a school age daughter. Maya’s husband owns a car and serves the locals as a taxi driver to earn a living. 
Maya has graduated from pedagogical college and works as a teacher at the local nursery school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is very small so Maya decided she should generate additional income.
She requests a loan to renovate a room in her house to start a special education and rehabilitation centre for disabled children there.
Children who have physical, mental and developmental disabilities will be provided with education according to their intellectual level. The center will work on weekends, when other schools are closed.
Maya has experience with disabled children and she can handle this challenge well. Maya loves children very much and hopes her project will be useful for them.

loans.use: to renovate a room in her home to start special education and a rehabilitation centre for disabled children

loans.name: Achiri Alice

texts.en:
This is Achiri Alice, she is married and has six children. They all live in a six bedroom apartment in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon.  she   has faced many challenges in life like: sickness, theft of all her business items, death of her family members and inadequate finance to start up a business of her own to fulfill her family's needs.
With this new loan, she will invest in buying more piglets, chickens, feed, and seedlings. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and the demand for pigs and chickens is high.  In addition, the waste from chickens and pigs will be used in the farm as fertilizer to increase the yield. With this business activity, the community will benefit from the manure and greater availability of chickens and pigs for different occasions. With the profit from this loan, she will support her family's needs, ensure her childrens' education is paid for, expand her poultry and pig farm and also save some money to undertake bigger investments in the future. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment timeframe and also, because borrowers are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy chicks, piglets, feed and seedlings

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa de 64 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar  vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo quien trabaja y ayuda en la casa. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; doña Felipa es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de  salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y cal. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa, 64, lives in a relative’s house with her lifelong partner and her son, who works and helps in the house.  She has a tortilla bakery which is very well-known in the area where she lives.  She has a lot of customers because she sells the best hot tortillas, with the quickest service and at really good prices.

Felipa is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to succeed.  She has a winning mentality which helps her to always stay ahead of the competition.  She believes that when somebody wants something, they should know that the risks involved make life worthwhile.  She is willing to take a risk to try and expand her business.  That is why she is asking Apoyo Integral for a loan which will allow her to buy corn in bulk and lime powder.  She hopes that this way, she will be able to provide economic stability for her household and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child age 20 years. In 2000, Rugiatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, Rugiatu plans to change her business to a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
This is Patience, she is married and is a mother of six children, with one of them below the age of fifteen. They all live in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Cameroon.  She has faced many challenges in life like: inadequate finance to start up a business, sickness and educating her children. With this new loan she has requested she will invest in her business by buying different brands of drinks in bulk as well as cups, tables, chickens and feed for her farm.
She thinks this business will succeed because, she has been doing it for a long time. The business has a good location which is great for her customers. In addition to that, the demand for chickens is high due to the increasing population.
With this business activity, the community will benefit because transportation costs will be reduced for clients as they will not have to travel far for a drink, it will also help to create unity among the patrons and build a team spirit among them in this place to spend time together. With the profit from this loan, she will invest back into her business and take care of her children’s education and health.
She prefers loans form GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the borrowers are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Also, social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy different brands of drinks as well as tables, cups, feed and chickens for her farm

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is Beatrice, she is married and has three children, one of which is below fifteen years of age. They all live in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda.  She has faced many challenges in life like: sickness, an accident, inadequate finance to start up a business and the death of family members.
With this new loan she has requested, she will invest in buying more chicks for her farm, feed, seedlings like beans, yams, maize, coca yams and increase stock at her store of sweets, bread, and biscuits. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and the demand for chickens is high. She has regular customers because her  store has a great location. In addition, the manure from the chickens will be used on the farm to increase yield. With this business activity, the community will benefit from manure which will be used for farming, reduced transportation costs for her nearby clients and the availability of chickens for people to buy for special occasions. 
With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's quality education, expand her provision store, invest in her poultry farm and also save some money to undertake bigger investments. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the borrowers are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Also, social needs of members are met at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy items such as biscuits, bread, sweets, seedlings and chickens for her farm

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María Julia es una mujer luchadora, con muchos sueños, muchas ambiciones positivas en la vida las cuales poco a poco ha sabido enfrentar ya que ella no solo se las ha propuesto a cumplir para salir adelante si no como un reto que debe de enfrentar y tomar para cumplirlo y no dejar las ideas en la nada.  Ella tiene 33 años de edad es casada y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales tres estudian y apoyan a sus padres en las actividades del campo y un menor aun en lactancia, ama de casa y agricultora por tradición. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por lo que diariamente trabaja muy fuerte para que sus hijos no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud. El terreno que ella y su familia trabaja está en la misma área donde está ubicada su casa de habitación por lo que la asistencia y mantenimiento es más fácil y más constante.  
Sus sueños como madre de familia son los verlos convertidos en profesionales, sentirse orgullosa del esfuerzo que ella y su esposo hacen para que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida, un mejor futuro y mejores oportunidades de las que ellos pudieron tener. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual pretende comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliares, entre otros que darán una mejor protección a sus cultivos y un mejor follaje.
texts.en:
María Julia is a determined woman, with many dreams and many positive ambitions in her life. Little by little she has figured out how to tackle them, so that now her ambitions are not only to get by, but also to challenge herself to achieve more and not to leave her ideas unfulfilled. 

She is 33 years old, is married, and is the mother of four children. Of these, three go to school and help their parents in the field, and the youngest is still breastfeeding. She is a homemaker and farmer, following her family tradition. María Julia did not have the opportunity to study, and so she works very hard every day so that her children do not have to suffer the same situation as she did when she was young. The land that she and her family work is located in the same area as their house, which makes it easier to constantly tend and maintain it.

Her dreams as a mother are to see her children become professionals, and to feel proud of the effort that she and her husband make so that their children have a better life, a better future, and better opportunities than they themselves had. For this reason she has sought a loan with which she hopes to buy fertilizers, manure, and other inputs that will give a better protection to her crops and help produce better foliage.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Рузибой живет и работает в районе Гиссар. Все свободное время проводит на работе. У него имеется мельница, на которой измельчает муку. Потом он сдает мешки муки оптом в магазины. Он занимается этой деятельностью уже 7 лет. В данный момент Рузибою 28 лет, он не женатый и не имеет детей. Рузибой может позволить себе пропадать на работе. Но он хочет поменять жизнь и обзавестись семьей. Сейчас его мельница сломалась и чтобы отремонтировать он просит кредит. Когда мельница будет отремонтирована, Рузибой приступит к работе. Он усердно работает и в будущем хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он планирует купить еще одну новую мельницу и открыть мучной магазин. Тогда у него будет достаточно денег, чтобы жениться и обеспечивать свою будущую жену и детей, о которых он так мечтает.
texts.en:
Ruziboy lives and works in the Gissar region of Tajikistan, grinding and selling sacks of flour wholesale to various stores for the past 7 years.  He is a bit of a workaholic and spends all his free time working, but would like to eventually settle down and make time for raising a family; he is currently 28 years old, unmarried and without children.    

Recently, his flour-grinding machine broke down; to repair it, he is seeking a loan.  As soon as his flour grinder is repaired, he will be able to start working again.  He works very hard, and hopes to expand his business in the future by buying another flour grinder and opening his own flour store.  By doing so, he will be financially secure enough to get married and provide for his future wife and children; to have the family he has been dreaming of.

loans.use: repair his flour grinder

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 48 años de edad  vive en casa de un familiar con sus dos hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, el  se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de plantas a través un vivero que tienen en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años, tiene mucha clientela fija que lo buscan por los buenos precios con que vende su mercadería, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don julio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, tierra negra, bolsas, semillas y todos los utensilios necesarios para seguir  con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Julio is 48 years old, and he lives at a relative's house with his two sons, who are 13 and 11 years old. Julio works in a plant nursery that opened in his home 9 years ago, and he has a lot of regular clients who keep coming back because of the good prices offered; with the income Julio is able to cover some of the house expenses.

Now Julio is requesting this loan to buy compost, topsoil, bags, seeds and the necessary tools to continue to perform his job and to increase his income to provide a better quality of life for his children, without any constraints.

loans.use: to buy compost, topsoil, bags, seeds and tools.

loans.name: Eva Yolanda

texts.es: Eva  de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de sal por mayor y menor en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee clientela fija que la buscan por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña Eva esta solicitando a integral un préstamo para comprar más sal por quintales para poder seguir con su negocio que le ha generado buenas ganancias y asi darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: 68-year-old Eva lives in her own house with her family. For several years she has made a living by selling salt wholesale and at retail prices in the market near her home. She has fixed clientele who come to her for her good prices. She manages to settle her household expenses with the profits from her work. Eva is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to purchase quintals of salt so she can continue with her business, which has generated good profits for her, and thereby give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase more quintals of salt

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es: Josefa Nuvia habita en un barrio pobre de Managua, tiene varios años de ser comerciante minorista de ropa, calzado y muchos más productos. Ella cubre la mitad de los gastos de su familia, especialmente la educación de su hija de 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja largas jornadas como operador de un autobús y juntos han construido las bases para el futuro de su familia.  Doña Josefa solicita el crédito para comprar y ofrecer más y nuevos productos a sus clientes como: ropa, zapatos, carteras de dama y cosméticos. Ella siempre tiene pedidos que cumplir que le permite respaldar su crédito con AFODENIC.
texts.en: Josefa Nuvia lives in a poor neighbourhood of Managua. She has had a small business selling clothes, shoes, and many other products for several years. She covers half her family’s expenses, including the education of her 16-year-old daughter. Her husband works long days as a bus operator. Together they have built a foundation for the future of their family. Josefa is requesting the loan in order to purchase and offer more new products to her clients, such as clothes, shoes, ladies’ handbags, and cosmetics. She always has orders to fill, which allows her to back her loan with AFODENIC.

loans.use: to purchase and offer more new products to her clients, such as clothes, shoes, ladies' handbags, and cosmetics

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él es un hombre  emprendedor y luchador. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su lugar de  residencia. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Mario lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Mario esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de  más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposa.
texts.en: 56-year-old Mario lives in his own house with his partner. He is an enterprising and determined man. Several years ago he decided to set up a small business in his home. The business consists of a small shop that he has managed to keep for several years with great effort and dedication. He has a lot of customers, since the customers are the most important thing to Mario. He always attends to them with a smile and is very friendly, which, in addition to always having what the clients are looking for, is why he has gained the confidence of many in the area.
