She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, tomatoes, cucumber, cabbages, etc. that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Vaione needs a loan to buy  vegetable seeds, gloves, a rake, garden hose, fertilizer and a garden shovel. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Vaione will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, a rake, garden hose, fertilizer and a garden shovel

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y no cuenta con hijos dependientes. Vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola ubicada en la costa norte del Perú, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. La comunidad es una zona bastante tranquila con pequeños empresarios que dependen de la agricultura para subsistir.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su establecimiento esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Ahí atiende la demanda de sus vecinos y clientes por productos de uso diario. Esta actividad le permite solventar las necesidades de su familia, por lo que se esfuerza en administrarlo bien.

Antonio está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio, comprando más mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas. El piensa contar con mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Antonio is 52 years old, married, and has no dependent children. He lives with his wife in the district of Oyotún, an agricultural region located on the north coast of Peru It is an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. The town is a quiet area with small businesspeople who depend of agriculture to survive.

Antonio makes a living selling groceries, and has over 10 years of experience in this business. His premises is located in his home, where he attends to the requests of his neighbors and customers for everyday items. This activity allows him to pay for what his family needs, which is why he makes an effort to manage it well.

Antonio is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to expand his business, buying more merchandize. This investment will enable him to boost his sales. He plans to increase his product inventory to that he can meet the various needs, requirements and tastes of his customers that live in the area.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more merchandize.

loans.name: Joel Esau

texts.es:
Joel es un joven de 26 años,  estudio hasta noveno grado,  es soltero, vive con la mamá y tres hermanos.

Joel posee una tienda,  hace tres años que decidió en el lugar donde vive. Antes la mamá tenía ese negocio, pero cuando murió el papá, su mamá decidió con no seguir con la tienda;  pero Joel decido seguir el negocio, ya que era buena la venta en la casa,  su  mamá  también le ayuda a vender cuando él no está, también tiene un molino de nixtamal. 

Joel con el préstamo le servirá, para comprar  productos para surtir la tienda, como:  arroz, frijoles, aceite y azúcar, también golosinas como churro y dulces, prepara el molino ya que en el cantón es el único molino y le visitan todo los que habitan ahí.

Los sueños de Joel es tener la tienda muy surtida, con los productos que los clientes buscan y así queden muy satisfechos cuando le visiten ya que cuando van a moler buscan mucho en la tienda, también cuando él decida casarse pueda tener como para darle una muy buena vida económica a ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joel is a young 26 year old man who studied through ninth grade.  He is single and lives with his mother and three brothers. 

Joel owns a store that he opened three years ago in his home.  His mother ran the business previously, but when Joel's father died, his mother decided not to continue with the store.  Joel decided to take on the business, since sales were good, and his mother still assists when he is away from home. He also has a corn grinder for making tamales. 

Joel plans to use his loan to buy products to supply the story, including the following: rice, beans, oil and sugar, as well as candies and snacks like churros and sweets. He also offers corn meal grinding since he has the only grinder in the neighborhood and thus everyone who lives in the area visits to use it. 

Joel's dream is to have a fully stocked store, with products that his customers want, and in that way to make them very satisfied when they visit since when they come to use the grinder they do a lot of shopping at the store.  Also, when he decides to marry, the business will help him provide a better quality of life for his children.

loans.use: To purchase product to supply his store such as rice, beans, oil and sugar, as well as candies and snacks like churros and sweets.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe, a 40-year-old married woman with four children, has run a small business selling fish, crabs, and octopus in her community for three years. Having joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital, Pepe has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, goggles, a life jacket and fishing rod. With her earnings, she will continue to provide for her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, goggles, a life jacket and fishing rod

loans.name: Chebet

texts.en:
Chebet lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. She has one child and has been doing this work for six years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and maize.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming:'dairy farming and horticultural farming'. Her biggest challenge is "insufficient funds.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Cheseger."

Chebet was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "It has affordable interest"  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Deals with groups."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit her family," Chebet said that the chaff cutter will ensure that her cows have enough feeds and thus produce more income which will improve her family's living standards.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Chebet owns the following: cow, poultry, motorcycle but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and a TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 42 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina sells fish in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years. 

Cristina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en:
Elenoa is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She sells fish, octopus, and crabs in her community, which she has been doing for three years. 

Elenoa is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to purchase a life jacket, fishing net, spears, fishing rod, goggles, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Elenoa has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to purchase a life jacket, fishing net, spears, fishing rod, goggles, and a cooler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as: purlins, sand, cement, sheet metal roofing, cement blocks and tile.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of the country. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk and tea. She says that the most enjoyable thing about farming is the increased income she receives from dairy farming. Her biggest challenge is lack of financing. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Moita.'

Hellen chose to pursue financing from Juhudi Kilimo to increase her income. She learned that Juhudi Kilimo helps fund low income earners during the organization's required micro-finance training session. Her highest monthly expenses are farming costs and this loan will benefit her family by helping her increase her income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hellen owns cows and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and a TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. Her primary income sources are crops, and besides farming, she also has a personal business. She has no children and has been doing this work for 2 years. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'selling her products.' Her biggest challenge is 'preparation of a pond.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kamau.'

Caroline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'low interest.'  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Assisting farmers in doing agri business.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Caroline replied 'income will improve our living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caroline owns the following: a cow and a pump, but does not own a pig, poultry, bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, a TV, and a DVD player, but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

loans.use: to start fish farming.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUESTRA SEÑORA DEL CARMEN, la socia Sonia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar ,leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solcito el crédito para la compra de azúcar y leche para su negocio.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de carnes rojas, libreria, crianza de animales menores.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the NUESTRA SEÑORA DEL CARMEN communal bank . She is 38 years old, is single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily tasks with running the grocery shop. Sonia sells different sorts of products such as rice, sugar, milk and other items. She has had the business for a good while and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to carry on working so she can continue to support her family in this way. 

Sonia asked for the loan to buy sugar and milk for her business. Sonia is grateful for the loan provided and promises to meet the agreed payments.

The other members have businesses selling vegetables, selling fruit, selling red meat, a book shop and rearing small animals.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy pineapple-producing region. He has 2 children, and has been doing this work for 7 years. His primary income sources are crops, tea, milk, and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'selling the farm output and the income received.' His biggest challenge is 'lack of enough manpower when cultivating the farm.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Mrembo, kireri, gicharu, kiiru, and kamindira.'

Godfrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because of assisting farmers. 'This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Gives financial support to farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Godfrey replied 'Income from the pig farming will improve living standards and pay school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Godfrey owns the following: a cow, poultry, a bicycle, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has 3 children and has been doing mixed farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling his farm produce.' His biggest challenge is 'Watering crops in drought seasons and that is why he wants to purchase a water pump.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Samuel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'it has better loan terms.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'One can improve their lives through borrowing.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family.', Samuel replied 'Will improve his farming hence more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samuel owns the following: a cow, poultry, a pump, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household solar power, a TV, and a DVD player, but does not have a mosquito net, electricity, running water, or a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 57 years old and is widowed with three children. Erma works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 22000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items like hair conditioner, detergent soap, juice, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her store.

Erma has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items.

Erma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like hair conditioner, detergent soap, juice, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'producing and selling milk.' Her biggest challenge is 'Availability of animals feeds during the dry seasons.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kilimo.'

Rosina was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Was encouraged by her group members to join them..'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'how to manage the little cash she gets.'

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rosina replied 'they will always have a balanced diet.' Rosina owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside junto a su madre en el municipio de San Rafael Lempira. Ella trabajo en una maquila anteriormente y  hace 8 años decidió por tener su propia actividad de negocio donde vende ropa nueva y usada, pantalones, camisas, blusas, achinería y útiles escolares. Esta solicitando 20,000 Lempiras para surtir de ropa nueva y usada como Jeans, vestidos, camisetas, productos de achinería y útiles escolares, con el propósito de incrementar el inventario y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan es surtir y crecer en clientes, y con los ingresos tener mejor condición de vida y tener solvencia económica.
texts.en: María is 37 years old and lives with her partner and her mother in the town of San Rafael Lempira.  She worked in a factory previously and eight years ago she decided to open her own store where she sells new and used clothing, pants, shirts, blouses, diverse wares, and school supplies.  Her goal is to increase her inventory and thus obtain better sales.  Her plan is to supply her business and to grow her customer base. With her income she hopes to improve her quality of life and be economically stable.

loans.use: To supply new and used clothing like Jeans, dresses, t-shirts, and various wares and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente, con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, controles de plagas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
The client has cultivated the land for many years. With a great deal of dedication he grows corn and beans, which allows him to support his household. He is known for being a hard-working, honest and responsible man. He lives with his family, which is composed of his wife and his five-year-old son.

He and his wife work very hard to help their family get ahead in life and provide them with better living conditions than they had. Thanks to his knowledge of agriculture, this is how he manages to support his household. 

Given that it is the only way he knows to earn an honest living, and with a great desire to succeed, he approached this institution to request a loan. This because the planting season has begun and it is necessary to begin planting as soon as possible. This is the reason he is requesting a loan, as he needs to invest in the purchase of the necessary agricultural supplies for planting such as: seeds, manures, insecticides, pest-control agents, etc. 

He trusting in God and in his work that in this way he will succeed in having an abundant harvest. This will allow him to access a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manures, insecticides, pest-control agents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la venta de medicina popular en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene lleva el pan diario a su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hija y su esposa quién es empleada en una maquila y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda y construir un cuarto y un muro de división en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita el crédito y poder comprar cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos, etc. para poder vivir más seguros y cómodos con su familia ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizar dicha construcción.
texts.en:
This borrower has a business selling over-the-counter medicines in the various markets that are located close to his house.  He supports his household with the earnings from this business. He lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter.  His wife works in a manufacturing plant, and helps with the household expenses.  

This borrower is requesting a loan to make improvements to his house and to build a room and dividing wall in the place shown in the photograph.  This is the reason that he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, etc.  He wants to be able to have a more secure and comfortable home for his family.  Due to his modest earnings, he needs a loan in order to be able to carry out this project.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: Luciano de 63 años de edad se dedica a la venta de periódico y refrescos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, don Luciano está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda y construir una pared en la entrada principal de su casa y construir un cuarto para su hijo por esa razón solicita el crédito y comprar lo materiales necesarios como: hierro, arena, cemento, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra , ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo y así el su familia puedan vivir más cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Luciano is 63 years old and earns a living selling newspapers and soft drinks. He has been running his business from his home for the last 3 years and with what he earns he is able to cover some of the household costs. He lives in his own house with his wife and son.

Luciano is asking for a loan to improve his home, to build a wall at the main entrance to his house and to build a room for his son. For this reason he is asking for the loan to buy the necessary materials such as iron, sand, cement and bricks and to pay for labour, since what he earns is not enough to cover the work. In this way his family can have more comfortable and secure living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron, sand, cement and bricks and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. He has 4 children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy farming.' His biggest challenge is: 'Market price is low.' Animals on the farm have been given the name of 'Keroi.'

Charles was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'it offers their loans at a low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'how to develop a consistent savings culture.'

His highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Charles replied: 'The family will have better living standards due to the increase in income.'

Charles owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya where a lot of miraa grows, which can be chewed like tobacco. She has five children and has been doing this work for 25 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal business.

She stated that "high returns" are what is most enjoyable about farming. Her biggest challenge is "insufficient capital." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kanini."

Regina was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "it offers quick and better services." She was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She replied, "savings are used as collateral."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Regina replied that it will "it will help her expand her poultry farm and hence give them more income, which will help to cater for her children's school fees."

Regina owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, running water, a TV and a DVD player, but does not have electricity, solar power or a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has one child and has been doing this work for 3 years. His primary income sources are milk and, besides farming, transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Horticulture!' His biggest challenge is 'Capital.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Benard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'they give friendly interest rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It helps me get agricultural asset that helps me generate income.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Benard replied: 'Generate more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benard owns the following: a cow and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: to construct a green house.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is 31 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She lives with her partner, who has his own business, and has three children, ages 6, 9, and 15. All three live at home with her; the oldest works and the other two are attending school.

For 10 years, Gertrude has been selling rice, oil, and coal on a table in the local market. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her goods wholesale, which is much more expensive. She likes to talk with her customers, and she learned how to sell from her auntie a long time ago. 

Gertrude has requested a loan to buy more rice, oil, and coal. In the future, she would like to have her own place in the market, and build a house for her and her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, and coal.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 39 years old and lives in the area of west point. She’s married and stopped her education in junior high. She has four children, ages 3, 4, 6, and 15.

Maima has been selling charcoal for the past six years. Her only worst experience some time is the rainy season.

Maima is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes and prays to God divine favor upon the lives of her children, so that their dreams will come into reality.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулнары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулнара занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 14 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку обогревателя.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 37 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Gulnara has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Gulnara works with livestock breeding, after having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows and 14 sheep. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulnara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows to increase the number of cattle. Gulnara plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for purchasing a heater.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is aged 39 years and is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a Spotter, and is a mother of three children. Two of her children are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business. Miriam works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses. 

Miriam operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and a variety of hanging plants. She also grows fruit bearing plants like pineapple. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Miriam dreams to grow her business in the coming years and to give all of her children a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies with the group. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her ornamental plant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing net, paint and food like rice for the family

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 41 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Maribel es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles, también ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, agujas, tijeras, repuestos para maquinas, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e  ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son.  She makes clothing and her business is located in her house.  Maribel is an incredible and exemplary woman because she is a very hard worker, responsible and positive. Many people have spoken highly of her as a person and of her work. She makes a variety of clothing at affordable prices but with good quality.  This is why many people prefer her. She has been doing this for 10 years and has a lot of experience with steady customers who prefer her more each day.

She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business so that she can buy necessary supplies such as: fabric, thread, elastic, needles, scissors, parts for her machines, etc. so she can make a variety of clothing. She does all of this so that she can provide better service to her customers so they will continue to buy from her thereby increasing her sales and income.  She hopes to achieve her goal and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, scissors, parts for her machines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a realizar viajes en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y responsabilidad a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, él desea mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder hacerlo por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para poder construir el baño, el servicio y una pila en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, con lo solicitado podrá comprar los materiales necesarios como: ladrillos, hierro, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, y poder ampliar mejor su vivienda donde el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en:
This borrower earns a living doing journeys in his vehicle through the different neighbourhoods around his place of residence. He has a lot of customers because of his friendly nature and responsible driving. With what he earns from his work he is able to cover some of the household expenses. 

He wants to improve his home but what he earns is not enough to cover the cost so for this reason he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so he can put in a bath, toilet and sink in the area shown in the photograph. With the loan he has requested he will be able to buy the necessary materials such as bricks, iron, sand, cement and to pay for labour, and be able to extend his home better so he and his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, sand, cement and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 2 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'mixed farming.' His biggest challenge is 'Animal diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Erick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'It will help him buy poultry so that he can expand his farming business.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They are for their development.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Erick replied 'Generate more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Erick owns the following: a cow and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, poultry, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power, but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this work for two years. His primary income sources are milk, tea farming (as shown in the photo) and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is 'farming dairy cows.' His biggest challenge is animal diseases. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Erick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, 'It gives us dairy insurance.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and he replied, 'They help us with soft loans for development.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Erick replied,  'Increase sources of more income.'

Erick owns cows and poultry but does not own pigs, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve works hard to support her family. Genevieve is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Genevieve has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, bamboo sticks, and spices, etc. for her business.

Genevieve has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Genevieve would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, bamboo sticks, and spices, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 39 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has four children between 1 and  19 years old, who live with her at home and go to school. She attended school through the fourth grade. Over the past eleven years she has been running table businesses which sell Vita, pepper, salt, onions, oil, seasoned oil, etc., in the local market. She started with her own money and with the high price of food ingredients in Monrovia she thought of selling food ingredients. Ruth has requested a loan to purchase more Vita, pepper, salt, onions, oil, seasoned oil, etc., to attract more customers. In the future, Ruth hopes to be a big business woman and have her own store. She is glad to be a BRAC-Kiva borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more Vita, pepper, salt, onions, oil, seasoned oil, etc., to attract more customers

loans.name: Pattie B.

texts.en:
Pattie B. is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 3 and 14 years old who are in school and live at home.

For the past three years, she has been selling soap and body cream. She started this business with money that she credit from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap and body cream for her business. 

In future, she wants to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and body cream for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 42 years old. She and her fiance live at Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She stopped her education at grade 4, and has six children between the ages of 3 and 28 years old; only four of them attend school, and five of them live at home. 

Since 2010 she has been selling coal in her community market; sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mary from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages 2 years and 12 years. One of her children is going to school. After she got married, Mary established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that moving door to door to sell her goods can be very difficult.

Mary requires a loan in order to buy perfume, pants, shoes, and clothes for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Mary plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy perfume, pants, shoes, and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 37 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children ages 3 months and 16 years old.  They all live with her and only the older one is attending school. 

For five years she has been selling sugar, oil, rice, etc in the local market. She sells during morning and evening times every day. About the business, she likes the profit making. 

Janet has requested a loan to purchase more sugar, oil, rice, etc. for her business. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous supports.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana de 32 años,  estudio hasta 9°¬- grado, es madre soltera de dos hijos. El padre de los hijos no le apoya, por es adicto a el alcohol, los niños dependen solo de ella y los dos asisten a la Escuela, el único apoyo que tiene es de su mamá por que vive en casa de ella.

Ana, tiene dos años de dedicarse al negocio de vender tortillas, en el mercado, el negocio lo realizo en el momento que se separó del compañero de vida, como una forma de buscar la mantención  de sus dos hijos, de la casa al negocio solo camina cuatro cuadras, por lo que le queda cerca, el afán por tortear lo inicia a las cinco de la mañana y termina a la una de la tarde; trabaja ocho horas sin descansar todos los días, le ayuda una prima, quien trabaja también todos los días con ella. 


El préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO, es para comprar maíz y  una plancha de gas propano. Al comprar el maíz le sale mejor y hasta más barato comprar por mayor y se ahorra tiempo. Al comprar lo que necesita mejorara su vida, porque al tener lo que necesita realizara mejor su trabajo.

Los sueños de Ana, es consolidarse bien con su negocio, para salir adelante con sus ideas , para sus hijos lo que más quisiera es tener las facilidades de enviarlos a la escuela y que sean profesionales con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana, age 32, went to school until the 9th grade.  She is the single mother of two children.  The children’s father does not support her because he is an alcoholic.  The children depend only upon her.  The two of them go to school.  The only support she has is from her mother because she lives in her house.

Ana has been selling tortillas in the market for two years.  She started the business at the time that she separated from her life partner.  She did this as a way of looking to support her two children.  She only walks four blocks from her house to the business because it is close by.  She starts working in her tortilla business at five in the morning, and she finishes at one in the afternoon.  She works eight hours a day every day without resting.  A cousin helps her; she also works every day with her.

The loan she has requested from the Fundación Campo is to buy corn and a propane gas griddle.  She will do better when she buys the corn.  It is cheaper wholesale, and it saves time.  Her life will improve when she buys what she needs because she will do her job better when she has what she needs.

Ana’s dream is to strengthen her business in order to get ahead with her plans.  What she would like the most for her children is to have the means to send them to school and that they become professionals with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy corn and a propane gas griddle.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 45 year old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children aged 21,16 and 9 years old respectively. 

Lina has a fish vending business. She sells various types of fresh fish to the people in her community. Her business started 7 years ago.  Lina is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish and octopus to resell.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fish vending business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and octopus to resell.

loans.name: Melikoy

texts.ru: Меликой милая женщина, обладающей мастерством шитья. Ей 34 года. Она замужем, детей еще не имеет. Так как ее муж находится в России и работает там шефповаром в одном из ресторанов, Меликой проживает в районе Яван с сестрой. Меликой самостоятельная и независимая женщина. Она в прошлом году начала свое швейное дело и уже год как принимает заказы у себя дома. Ей в деятельности помогает сестра. Меликой в основном вышивает одеяла, подушки и шторы. Это довольно востребованный бизнес. Сейчас Меликой просит кредит для расширения своего дела. Она на сумму кредита хочет приобрести швейную машинку и прессовую заклепку. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Melikoy is a sweet woman, who possesses the skill of sewing. She is 34 years old. She is married, but does not have children yet. As her husband is in Russia and works as a chef at one of the restaurants there, Melikoy lives in the Yavan region with her sister. 

Melikoy is an independent woman. Last year she started her sewing business and has already taken orders in her home for a year. Her sister helps her with the business. Melikoy mainly embroiders blankets, pillows and curtains. It is a business with fairly high demand. 

Currently, Melikoy requests a loan to expand her business. She would like to purchase a sewing machine and a rivet press for the loan amount. She hopes for your sympathy.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a rivet press

loans.name: Helem

texts.en:
Helem is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Helem has a rope making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials to be used for making rope.

Helem has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to be used for making rope

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is very grateful that he was able to get his first Kiva loan and he was able to pay back the loan with the challenges that his business faces.

Nicholas is a barber and he has been in the business for more than ten years. With his first loan, he was able to buy more shaving machines for the business and his business experienced growth. Now, he seeks another loan to open another branch of his business and to be able to employ people to work for him.  The challenges that he faces in his business are competition and the high cost of electricity.

He hopes that he will be able to pay school fees for his children using the income that he will raise.

loans.use: to open another branch of his barber shop business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна уже пользовалась кредитами КИВА в прошлом. Со времени использования предыдущего кредита доходы Татьяны увеличились за счет приобретенной и своевременно реализованной партии товара, бизнес в основном остался без изменений. Сын Татьяны в этом году пошел в первый класс. 
В этот раз Татьяна обратилась за финансовой помощью в размере 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар для нового сезона торговли и продолжать поддерживать стабильность своего бизнеса, обеспечивая семью всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Tatyana has taken loans from Kiva previously. Through her previous loan, Tatyana increased her income through acquiring and selling the goods. The business has remained unchanged. 

This year Tatyana's son started school. This time Tatyana applied for financial support in the amount of 22,000 hryvnia, in order to purchase goods for the new season and to continue to maintain the stability of her business, to provide her family with all things necessary.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus earns a living operating a chainsaw.  He is 34 years old, single and lives in Kinamandagan, Lazi, Siquijor. He is now well known for the good quality of services that he offers.  He has already purchased some new chainsaws, and this has enabled him to save money.  His services are self-sustainable and have become profitable, he earned 6,000 PHP per month.  
He is seeking a 30,000 PHP loan.  He would like to use the loan to purchase a chainsaw and wood. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few  months.  In his previous loans he has never had a delinquency.  Jesus is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of his business venture.

loans.use: To buy a chainsaw and wood

loans.name: Ederlito

texts.en:
Ederlito is married with four children. Ederlito is 39 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Philippines.

Ederlito is a farmer and has pigs and piglets to earn a living. This is how he supports his family, and he has been doing this for five years. He wants to expand his business by buying additional pigs for hog raising. In the future, Ederlito hopes to have a farm.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs for hog raising

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
This is Gilbert, 34, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Mabel and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.
  
Gilbert operates a silkscreen printing business. Silkscreen printing is the process of creating a stencil in a mesh screen and then using a squeegee and pushing the inks through the mesh onto the shirt or garment. Clients go to him to request printing; they give their desired pattern or design. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 per week.  

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15, 000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like paint, screen, and shirts. 

Gilbert hopes to expand his business and dreams of giving his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials like paint, screens, and shirts.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 59 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Don Ramón, tiene 51 años de edad, casado, tiene 8 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro, junto a su esposa y 4 de sus hijos. En busca de obtener sus ingresos para la manutención familiar, hace 8 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa como pantalones, jeans y camisas nuevas y usadas. Su negocio es ambulante él se ubica con su negocio en la calle peatonal de la ciudad. Ha mantenido esta actividad mediante varios préstamos que ha solicitado a ODEF, este préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras  con el cual necesita comprar más mercadería de ropa como pantalones y camisas para surtir e incrementar las ventas y obtener mejores ingresos. Su meta es mantener y mejorar cada día su negocio para apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio y darles una mejor condición de vida a cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Ramón, 51, is married and has 8 children. He lives in the town of Morazán, Yoro, with his wife and four of his children. Eight years ago he decided to sell clothes such as trousers, jeans and new and used shirts in order to have an income to support his family. His business is ambulatory; he sets up shop along the sidewalk in town. He’s been able to stay in business thanks to several loans which he has had from ODEF. 

This loan he is requesting is for 10,000 Lempiras, which he needs to buy more clothing such as trousers and shirts so he can stock his business, increase sales and have a better income. 

His goal is to stay in business and improve it every day to support his children’s schooling and provide each one of them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new and used shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса – из Мелитополя. У нее есть муж и двое взрослых сыновей. Она занимается рыночным предпринимательством, торгуя на местном рынке женской одеждой вот уже 18 лет. У нее своя торговая точка, что облегчает ее работу и уменьшает затраты на аренду. 
Ларисе необходима сумма в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар для торговли в этом сезоне, а именно, платья, кофты и блузы. У Ларисы большой опыт работы в этой сфере торговли, она знает, какой именно сезонный товар продается лучше и на что появляется спрос в каждом сезоне. Поэтому и это капиталовложение будет использовано рационально и будет способствовать дальнейшему развитию бизнеса Ларисы.
texts.en:
Larisa is from Melitopol. She has a husband and two adult sons. She works with sales, selling women's clothing at the local market for 18 years already. She has her point of sales, where simplifies her works and reduces the cost of rent. Larisa needs a sum of 21,000 hryvnia in order to purchase goods for selling this season, specifically dresses, sweaters and blouses. 

Larisa has long experience in working in this area of sales. She knows which type of seasonal goods sells the best, and what is in demand in each season. Therefore, this investment will also be spent rationally and will help in the further development of Larisa's business.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, sweaters and blouses for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 56, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Felipe, a mechanic, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a food stand. She offers siomai and buko juice. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy siomai (also called pork dumplings), buko and other ingredients for her food stand.

Alicia hopes that her business will flourish and dreams to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for siomai, buko and other ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Ma. Elena requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

She has been in this business for three years, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Agustina

texts.es:
Ana, tiene oportunidad de hacer crecer más su negocio de pupuseria, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para contar con el capital suficiente para responder a la demanda; invertirá en compra de aceite, tomates, carne, quesillo y repollo.
Con el crédito anterior ella mejoro su calidad de producto y servicio, lo que le permitió un aumento en su número de clientes y obtener mayores ganancias. Su familia tiene mejor calidad de vida, su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio para la superación familiar
texts.en: Ana has the opportunity to further expand her pupusa (traditional Salvadorian corn-based food) business. She is requesting a new loan to have sufficient capital to need her demand. Ana will invest it buying oil, tomatoes, meat, cheese and cabbage. With her previous loan she improves the quality of her service and product. Which brought about an increase in the number of clients and generated more revenues. She improved her family's quality of living. Her dream is to continue expanding her business for the improvement of her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil, tomatoes, meat, cheese and cabbage.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Laila is 31 years old and her children are in school.

Laila has a fishing business in the Philippines. Laila requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Laila has been in this business for three years. In the future, Laila would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Evangelinge

texts.en:
Evangelinge is 53 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Evangelinge runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years.  She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, soy sauce, etc.

In the future Evangelinge would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Jofer

texts.en:
Jofer, a married man with children, is a farmer. All his children attend school, working hard for their future. He is requesting a Kiva loan to finance his farming labor costs and to buy fertilizer to have  better rice production by the next harvest season. 

Making good in the farming business has been Jofer's way of battling their poor economic situation though the profitability of this activity is affected most of the time by weather conditions, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, Jofer is seeking also not only the lenders' generosity and understanding but through God's grace, hoping he can be successful in farming for his family's sake.

loans.use: to finance his farming labor costs and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like tires, chains, nuts and bolts, and additional stock for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a 34-year-old woman from Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

In order to survive and sustain the family, Ligaya and her husband are engaged in corn production to earn a living. Her family has been in this business for 10 years as their main source of income. 

Ligaya became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 20,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase farm inputs and to pay for labor costs associated with corn production. She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and to earn an adequate income from her business.

Ligaya deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC and she repays her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs and to pay labor costs for land cultivation

location.town: Ozamis-Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ranil

texts.en:
This is Ranil, 36, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Liza, his business partner. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ranil operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Ranil dreams of having a bigger food stall and hopes to have a better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in his business

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito is a 61-year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with one child aged 22. His business started more than 10 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy motorcycle parts like piston rings and tyres and maintenance like an overhaul, to have safe travels.  In the future, he hopes to expand his motorcycle transport services and increase business profitability to pay for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts like piston rings and tyres and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old and a widow with four children; three of her children are still in school. Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, candies, canned goods, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jose Herbert

texts.es:
José, tiene la necesidad de un nuevo crédito por que su herramienta de trabajo, que es una moto taxi  se le ha dañado y necesita comprar fricciones y llantas para repararla y poder reanudar su labores.
 Con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar las condiciones de trabajo que tenia y con esto aumento el número de clientes dando como resultado mayores ganancias. Para su familia las condiciones de vida han cambiado pues, ya hay nuevos miembros en ella.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because his mototaxi, which is a tool for his work, has been damaged. He needs to buy brake pads and tires to repair it and to be able to resume his work.

With the previous loan he was able to improve the conditions of work that he had and thus increase the number of customers. This gave better results and higher earnings. For his family the conditions of life have changed. Also, there are no new members in the family.

loans.use: to buy brake pads and tires.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She is running a business in her house by selling cigarettes, noodles, water, body lotion, glue, paper and plates. She is making a good income from her selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town nearby the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her working capital of $50.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, water, body lotion, glue, paper and plates.

loans.name: Eleoupu

texts.en:
Eleoupu is a 52-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a business selling tinned food, frozen food, soap, snacks, and other items in her community. She has three years of experience with this business.

Eleoupu has requested a loan to buy tinned fish, flour, sugar, noodles, rice, a new refrigerator, soft drinks, cigarettes, toilet rolls and snacks. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy tinned fish, flour, sugar, noodles, rice, a new refrigerator, soft drinks, cigarettes, toilet rolls and snacks

loans.name: Fualaau

texts.en: Fualaau is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation that grows taro, bananas, and taamu (a large root vegetable like taro) to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Fualaau has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a wheel barrow, and some taro root and to pay for her children's fees. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Fualaau hopes to improve her house and save more for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and some taro root and to pay for her children's school fees.
